This  restaurant is close to my house.  My daughter, sister and I don't eat meat and every time we look for a vegetarian restaurant, this place shows up.  Finally last night we decided to try it.  

We were seated for a party of four.  The waiter who was a young male, likely in his 20s came over and asked us if we wanted to order something to drink.  I told him we would start with water all around.  For some reason,.. this infuriated him.   He viciously smashed his hand and down and took all of our drink menus (we all had one ).  Someone else  brought our waters.  The next time I saw our waiter, I asked him for drink menus. I explained to hime that we just ordered water when we sat down but didn't have a chance to see the menu.  He turned around to the table behind him, grabbed the drink menu and slammed it down on our table and walked away.

When he finally arrived at our table for our order, I asked him to recommend something vegetarian.  He told me they had nothing.  I repeatedly asked him...just to clarify...if they had anything or could make anything vegetarian.  He just said NO NO NO.  

I can get a veggie plate in a steak house.  Seriously?  a Vietnamese restaurant doesn't have anything vegetarian??

After repeatedly asking...we had to leave.   All four of us got up and left.

This server should be fired.   Worst service ever.  DONT EAT HERE   OR SUPPORT RESTAURANTS THAT TREAT THEIR CUSTOMERS POORLY.  Terrible experience.
author: Robin W.

description:
Sunflower is my favorite spot in the Potrero Hill of SF, and I've been here for a few dozen times.  The quality of food is excellent and consistent.  (Also, the place is clean if that's important to you)   Most servers here aren't very friendly and never smile, but I have learned to not be bothered by it and just enjoy my dining.

They serve some casual dishes like Pho and Fried Rice if you are in a hurry, but also some scrumptious dishes like Halibut and Crab Meat for a relaxed dining.

Some of my favorites are:
Shrimp Spring Rolls - it's classic
Imperial Rolls - it's deep fried
Noodle Soups (Beef, Chicken & Seafood) are simple yet satisfying.
Shaken Beef is fantastic..!  it's always tender and tasty.
Steamed Sea Bass is fabulous..!  it comes out on a ginger soy sauce.  
Spicy Green Beans is simple and classic.
Garlic Noodle (I like to add prawns) is good for a big eater, but it's quite garlicky..!

Check it out if you're in the neighbor..!
author: Shin A.

description: Absolutely delicious food!! My friend and I were smiling with each bite. We had the shrimp spring rolls, fried dumplings, garlic noodles with veggies and chicken. The only constructive thing I'd say is that there wasn't much chicken in our garlic noodles. The main dishes are substantial and definitely shareable. Prices good too! We'll definitely come back.
author: Wendy R.

description:
Mouthwatering food. We came here close to closing time and they seemed a little miffed that we'd come in, and rushed us a little on ordering. The food came really quickly though, and was fabulous.
Try the fresh coconut milk, just because it looks awesome -- and is cold, too.
A little squeezed, but overall a nice, dark atmosphere. I'd come back just for the food.
author: Laura S.

description:
Pho is as good as any I've had. I haven't found anything to specifically differentiate Sunflower from other Vietnamese place I've eaten at- though I am no expert in Vietnamese food. 

I am a fan of the size of the restaurant. It feels cosy and is a good casual date venue. Parking is pretty decent to find (unlike the rest of the San Francisco) and it's tucked away from the busy industrial and tourist filled areas of the city. It won't be overcrowded.

Sunflower is especially great  for it's view. When you walk out of the restaurant you can see downtown SF to your north, and the bay to the east. Especially stunning at night.
author: Nicole C.

description: I think this is gonna be my best restaurant. So delicious and wonderful. Taste and service, everything is awesome.
author: Skipper LN L.

description:
This is a nice little neighborhood restaurant. I make my way here either to dine-in or for take out about every 6 weeks. They are always moderately busy, but the wait is never long. Take-out is SUPER speedy. I'm really bad at weekday meal-planning, so this is a huge plus for me. For dining in, the service is very efficient.

The beef noodle soup is incredibly comforting. Salty, warm, soupy deliciousness. The broth is flavorful and they provide lots of condiments. I always get the Imperial Rolls, and I always burn my mouth trying to get the yumminess in my belly as fast as humanly possible. Always worth it.

This isn't the best or the cheapest Vietnamese food I've ever had, but Sunflower is convenient, consistent and comforting. If you live around Potrero Hill, I highly recommend working this place into your casual weekday restaurant rotation.
author: Grace F.

description:
Visiting SF from NYC and had some great Vietnamese food here at Sunflower. Unfortunately, NYC doesn't have a lot of great options for Vietnamese food, so I was exited when the friends I was staying with lived right down the street from this place.
After we were seated and I saw that the food coming out to other tables looked very authentic, I was excited to get the Vietnamese Iced Coffee, and it did not disappoint! It was the best I have had in years! It erased all the memories of poor imitations of this beverage that I have had in NYC...
The food was equally delicious. We had spring rolls, imperial rolls, and entrees and everything was flavorful and fresh. The entrees are large and good for sharing around the table.
The staff was courteous and prompt with service, but they did not make us feel crowded. And the place was clean, well-lit, and had a nice breeze coming in through the open front door.
My only minor issue is I would have liked to see a little more descriptions of the dishes so you'd know what you are getting--I may have been slightly more adventurous if I had a general idea of ingredients in the menu items.
author: R F.

description:
Had lunch with a friend here a couple of times. If you come soon after it opens Saturday or Sunday you can snag a great table in the window. Had the vermicelli noodles with barbecue pork and spring rolls (the other time I tried the five-spice chicken - both delicious). Service is quick and they will refill your water glass many times. I also tried the fresh coconut, not sure if I'm a fan. If you like coconut water, you'll like it. It was a bit bland for my taste.
We were never kicked out despite finishing our food quickly and not ordering anything else. The staff is friendly and I would come back anytime I am in Potrero Hill.
author: Klara M.

description:
It's a great to place to get pho around Mission bay/Potrero hill area. I always order beef pho. It's a bit hard to find a parking spot there.

Their spring roll is a great appetizer to start. They also have a great lunch menu.
author: Hiromi K.

description:
Love this place!

The bf and I came here for lunch and it was pretty busy. But, we were able to snag seats by the window after another couple had left.

After looking over the menu for a few minutes, I ordered the garlic noodles with chicken, which was $9.75 because it's $2 for chicken, beef, or shrimp and $1.50 to add mixed vegetables or tofu. The bf had lunch special #2, which was soup, an imperial roll, salad, and BBQ pork for $8.95.

Our food came out in about 15 mins. The plate of garlic noodles was huge. At first, I was disappointed that I had just ordered a plate of garlic noodles with chicken, but after I tasted the garlic noodles, I was impressed. They tasted a little salty, but good nonetheless. The chicken was ok. Nothing outstanding. The garlic noodles were obviously the main focal point of the dish.

The bf let me have his veggie hot and sour soup and it was really good. I could've ate a whole bowl of it. I really enjoyed the pineapple chunks that added a distinct flavor and sweetness to the soup. He enjoyed the BBQ pork and salad. He also really liked the imperial roll. He said it was very flavorful and tasty. No complaints. 

We had a great lunch experience here and plan on coming back for their dinner service. The bf thought that the lunch special was a good size. It isn't as big of a portion like others have mentioned because the bf said it was the placement of the soup in the middle that makes the lunch special appear huge. It was a decent size though.

Customer service was pleasant and parking wasn't that hard to find. We'd rather go to this location than the one in the Mission. The lunch prices are great. Our bill before tip was $20. So, I highly suggest coming here for lunch and I'm pretty sure dinner is good as well. But, just a little pricier.
author: Fallon P.

description: The chicken salad is great! Small place and really popular, so make sure to come here early!
author: Jia A.

description:
This will probably be our new go-to Pho spot!!

Unlike your usual hole in the wall Vietnamese spots, Sunflower's ingredients are definitely higher quality. The beef was better as well as the seafood (squid, shrimp, fishcake). You might pay a dollar or two more than you regular Irving spot, but It's still under $10 a bowl so works for me!

Service is amazing. I've never had my water refilled every 5 minutes. It was unbelievable.
author: Kristen C.

description:
I LOVE THE GARLIC NOODLES!!!! 

the pho is not really that great ... BUT GARLIC NOODLES! probably not great for fat girls like me =(

ill even give you directions. 
if you're coming from the north on 280: exit 18th street and turn right 
if you're coming from the south on 280: exit mariposa/18th street and turn left. 

go get their garlic noodles now!! =D
author: Annie Z.

description:
Hi! I'm Penny PA, a film industry Office PA who rates the best & worst places to buy your office lunch. My review, like all my reviews, is based on the experience of ordering for a large group of people - in this case, 45 folks.

FOOD: 5 stars
By far, this restaurant is the most popular among our crew -- the crispy imperial rolls, shaken beef, garlic noodles with veggie, beef or seafood, all amazing flavors. I wish I could eat it every day.

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 3.5 stars
If you call two or more days in advance, they can usually fulfill your catering order. Sunny is very helpful in determining exactly how much of each item you need for large groups - 30, 35, 40, 45 - and making sure it fits into your budget.

The last time we tried to order from here, I called a day in advance and asked for the food to be ready at 1:15PM the next day... but because this pickup time was right in the middle of their lunch rush, they said they wouldn't be able to fulfill our order. At the last minute, we had to go with a different restaurant instead.

I know it's demanding to place an order for a large group of people the day before or the day of, but sometimes this industry demands it... some restaurants can accommodate, no questions asked, but others (understandably) can't. Just something to keep in mind if you think about catering from Sunflower.

But the food... freakin amazing.
author: Penny P A.

description: So yesterday I took my boyfriend because he wanted the Sunflower Prawns (20.66). I didn't want to eat there because last time I had their Crab Fried rice and I wasn't pleased. So after I dropped my boyfriend off I decided to double back to get the Sunflower prawns my boyfriend had and boy were they good. Those noodles were so good.
author: LaRonda F.

description: I love this place!! I would give it 4.5 stars if I could. Half a star off because every time I come here I feel like I'm being rushed to finish my food. They have so many delicious options. I tend to get the noodle soup, but the garlic noodles are delicious too!! Love the atmosphere and the fact that they are a Vietnamese restaurant with more than just Pho and Vermicelli!
author: Erica V.

description: Good Vietnamese spot, gets crowded at lunch, a bit of a ventilation problem which on a hot day can be irritating. But tasty and fresh. Accomadating staff, quick service.
author: Matt A.

description:
Great little Vietnamese spot in Portrero Hill. It's slightly more expensive than the Little Saigon spots, but the place is very clean with friendly service. 

My brother and I ordered the beef pho and spring rolls. The spring rolls were freshly made with crisp vegetables. The beef pho had a great broth. Ask for meat on the side as the bowl is very hot and will cook that meat in an instant. (Who wants overdone beef anyway?)

The Vietnamese coffee was also strong and nicely brewed. Solid spot all around.
author: Koh K.

description:
My gf from Concord was down and we wanted to try a new place so i randomly picked Sunflower off of Yelp.  Driving there I was reminded how cute Potrero Hill has become and was excited when I saw the place also looked trendy.  It was pretty busy for a Saturday night but we were seated right away and the food came fast.  
Service - 2 stars - the waiters were not friendly just fast.  
Atmosphere - 4 stars - the place feels trendy and it's cute.
Food - 3.5 stars - wasn't amazing but pretty good and the servings were large so overall a good value.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I got tricked... 4 stars for this place?? 
The food was bland. I ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli with imperial roll. They didn't even bother to cut the chicken breast into smaller pieces. They gave me way too much vermicelli. I didn't have enough of fish sauce to mix all the ingredients together. Also I didn't like the vermicelli noodles that they used. It was thick and chewy. The only thing that saved this dish was the imperial roll. 
Service here... Just like any other asian restaurant. The waitress was rude and she didn't know the menu. 
I think I'm just gonna drive to Irving for good Viet food next time.
author: Donna M.

description:
Sunflower is a great Vietnamese restaurant on Potrero Hill!
Personally, the three things that make this restaurant a frequently visited spot is the great tasting food, beautiful location, and prompt service. 
I really enjoy the garlic noodles and of course I add either shrimp or chicken and vegetables. I also order a Vietnamese coffee or a Thai tea to complement my meal. 

The location is one of the best in San Francisco. I love going to Sunflower around dusk because the view of the San Francisco skyline when the sun is setting is priceless! Also parking is not difficult either. I usually don't have any trouble finding a spot with in minutes of looking. 

Also the service is wonderful! The servers are very prompt and always have a smile! Have a great dinner at the Sunflower!
author: Dominic P.

description:
Walked in with a party of six, and with an empty restaurant they still required that all of us be there before they seat us. For lunch. Then they insisted on putting us at a four person table, which I refused. 

Once the meal started though, all my hesitations melted away. Dishes are huge, very good, and also reasonably priced. I got a fresh coconut and lemongrass tofu lunch special. It looked like my dish could feed a family of 4. My husband ordered the five spice chicken, and he says it wasn't spicy but it was very flavorful. I could say the same for my dish.

We're already planning to go back.
author: Dimple B.

description:
I agree with all the other reviews who think the food here is bland.  The quality of the ingredients is very good, but lacks a lot of authentic taste.  I was hoping that it would have a decent amount of flavor, but all
In all the taste is super toned down.  Bring your mom n pop here, older relatives who never had Vietnamese food.. Or eat it once a year.
author: Demanding T.

description: Had lunch with my brother who was visiting from out of town.   Their lunch menu was very reasonably priced and had lots to choose from.   My brother and I both enjoyed our meals.   The staff was quick and friendly.  Everything was spot on!  Thanks
author: Matt D.

description:
I was so hopeful reading the reviews, but so let down when I tasted the dishes.  I don't understand the hype.  Plain and simple...it's Americanized Vietnamese food.  All the tradition flavors and seasonings have been washed out and diluted.  Nothing remarkable about the offerings.

-Shaken beef... moist but bland.
-Hot & sour soup... barely sour, only sweetness from the pineapples.
-Claypot catfish... didn't quite taste right.
-Banh xeo... too much mung bean, very starchy and heavy.  It's supposed to be  light like "crepe".LOL
-Imperial roll... it was actually the best thing we had.  Crispy fried rice paper stuffed with minced pork.

You really can't get excellent Vietnamese food in the City.  One must go to San Jose or to Socal.
author: MTBer I.

description:
Good food!!
Spring rolls are great and the soup  but horrible costumer service rude !!
author: Heymi R.

description:
Solid affordable Vietnamese.   Great atmosphere, fast service, good food.   It's not fancy or high end but it delivers with precision on what it does best.    

Tonight I had imperial rolls and vegtable pho. They load on the veggies!  Sooo good.
author: Susan C.

description: I was really excited about trying this place but unfortunately didn't get a chance to do that. It was about 6pm on Thursday night and I was meeting my wife and daughter here for dinner. They were running about 5min late and usually I would wait outside for them but since it was cold and the place was empty I decided to come in. I asked for a table for 3 and the waitress just started giving a really bad ATTITUDE about my party not being there. I looked around at all the empty and told her I'll just wait outside, I ended up calling my wife and decided on a different place to eat.
author: Chico B.

description: I love Potrero. It's always sunny and the views of downtown are breathtaking. The neighborhood is sleepy but new restaurants are popping up all the time. When I am in the mood for good Vietnamese food, I head to Sunflower. Don't pass up on the young coconut drink and the Vietnamese crepe.
author: Julia V.

description:
Great food.
But the service is horrible. 
I actually don't feel welcome at all. Over and over again.
author: Brian W.

description:
Came here for lunch. Its near my work. I ordered a chicken pho with egg noodles. It was OK. Not the best i've ever had. Good service, cute place. 

My recommendation: Hungry for Pho? This place will do.
author: Heather H.

description:
I had Saturday brunch here. I tried a few of the more exotic items on the menu (deep fried rice balls and a rice crepe), and my friend had one of the popular meat + rice combo plates. 

The presentation was quite nice, but simply put, it didn't feel like there had been any effort put into the food. The rice crepe and rice balls were bland and had no salt or flavor. My friend's combo plate was pretty standard fare, but there are more savory options nearby.
author: Michael W.

description: Couldn't decide what to eat- went for Vietnamese. Didn't regret it. Lunch special #4. Soooo good!!!
author: Silbana P.

description:
I have had so many bad experiences ordering take out from this restaurant I must be insane for trying again.

HOW DO YOU SCREW UP SPRING ROLLS AND RICE !?

The employee in charge of my order... 

LESLIE. 

SOMEONE FIRE THIS WOMAN! She has screwed up on my orders twice now!

I ordered... 

Shrimp Spring Rolls - for me
Vegetable Spring Rolls - for my boss
Steamed Jasmine Rice - for me

Fairly simple right? Wrong...

So first with (2) orders of rolls you should get (2) containers of peanut sauce right?

NOPE. Apparently for 2 orders of spring rolls you don't even get a single full container, you get about 1/2 of one... So my boss and I are going to share that between all these spring rolls. Great.

Now.. Usually when you order take out you utensils right? Chopsticks...maybe a plastic fork... 

NOPE. No utensils included... Apparently SunFlower likes you to eat steamed rice with your hands. Awesome.

When I called to inform her of the mistake she said I can come back and pick the stuff up. Which is all fine and dandy, but I work 15 minutes away by car. So I drove 15 minutes, found parking, went in grabbed my food. drove 15 minutes back to the office... about 35 minutes total.

So now she wants me to do that same thing again to fix her screw-up? That's an hour of driving back and forth... I asked her if she can have someone come deliver the items.
She said no that was impossible and laughed a little... but offered me a free soda for the trouble.

Are you kidding me?

So Leslie, you dumb, incompetent, service industry worker. You have lost my business for good this time. I sincerely hope nobody else makes the same mistake as me.
author: Aaron A.

description:
How did this place get 4star review is beyond me! Recent Sunday lunch: ordered five garlic noodles (signature dish) with different types of meat or shrimp. Every dish tasted different. From completely bland to overly salty. Two plates, the noodles were soggy and 'where's the garlic flavor"??  I ordered the Vietnamese crepe with meat n seafood, had two little diced up shrimp and a piece of meat of some sort. Tons of bean sprouts but had absolutely no taste, you must dip into the fish sauce...even that was bland. The crepe was overly pan fried, like eating a giant cracker. No one finished half of their plates and left.  Sad, I've been to the other location before in the Mission and it was not as bad.

Try "Yummy Yummy" or "PPQ" in the inner sunset, no comparison!!
author: Vee V.

description:
I had high expectations, but I wasn't satisfied, nor was anyone in my party. For starters, this isn't a Vietnamese restaurant, it's Chinese. The dishes are Vietnamese but they don't taste it - more like Vietnamese food cooked with Chinese ingredients. The lady in the kitchen who runs food is extremely rude and our server was a on the cold side. Being that the food was not authentic and the service was intimidating, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Don't waste your money...do yourself a favor, go to the hole in the wall with the flies and sticky table tops. At least they know what they're doing in the kitchen. Anyone who says they love Vietnamese food and thinks this place is good is a moron and needs to have their tongue cut out. Reading the 5 star reviews for this place is comical.
author: Alex T.

description:
Food is fine. This is about unacceptable manners. 

I live a block away, and I went there dozens of times over the years. I was sick, dressed in thick layers and with a scarf. The restaurant was half empty with 18 empty seats: 3 x 4-seat-, and 3 x 2-seat arrangements. We, a party of 2, explained that i had an upcoming cold, and that I would hence need to sit away from the drafty windows. Needless to say, all the waiter had to offer was a table - well guess - by the drafty window. There were plenty of other tables available, one away from all windows. But they wanted to keep that for a party of four. They could have easily separated two tables made to seat 2. If this would have been the only table for 4 available, it would have still been immensely rude, but since the restaurant was half empty there also was not even an economic rationale. And even if, you simply don't tell a sick customer who explicitly asks to sit in a warm spot to sit by the drafty window. 

So we went across the street to Goat Hill pizza, where they had absolutely no problem to not only offer us a non-drafty table, but to close the nearby windows, and even the door. 

Dear Sunflower people: whether it's with sick customers or not: there's more to life than making money. I hope your waiter will understand that one day too.
author: Thomas A.

description: I like this place.  The food is good, the menu is interesting, and the staff is nice.
author: Michael E.

description: Great food with insanely huge portions. I always forget how big they are and end up having food for 3 meals or 3 people.
author: Lana R.

description:
I am rating this restaurant 5 stars because of the following: 

Service: 
Prompt service. Servers are really nice and accommodating. 

Price: 
Average price and it is worth it. 

Food: 
Omg .... They have variety of food in their menu. We are vegetarian and they have food for us;) 

Wait time: lunch is usually a long wait but when you come in before or after lunch/dinner time, sure you will have a table right away.
author: Melanie T.

description:
This place gets a 4 because this is what I like about Vietnamese food:
Fresh tasting
Clean tasting and clean digs
Great location
No overpowering msg content or strong animal/fish smells
A slightly Americanized influence in the dishes
Good prices
Hefty portions

What can I say? I like ethnic but not when it's from the streets of a 3rd world country...shoot me, I just don't.

So to me, this neighborhood feel of a I-gotta-get-my-pho-fix is absolutely perfect!

Easy parking and the 20min wait at peak dinner (6pm) was fine-the evening was beautiful and the patrons friendly.

Beef Pho
Crab Meat Fried Rice
author: Susan A.

description: My absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant in the city! My favorites are the combo appetizer, garlic noodle and shaking beef. The combo can be a meal in itself and the shaking beef is extremely juicy. The service is outstanding here as well. Get.here.now!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Fantastic crispy imperial rolls and beef pho. Good broth with the Pho but wish they offered tripe and tendon too. 

I tried the garlic noodles given the reviews but found it a bit bland. I've had better garlic noodles downtown made with generous freshly chopped garlic.

I'm glad there is a Vietnamese restaurant in Potrero hill. Will definitely come back again to try other things on their menu. Keep up the good service.
author: Monica L.

description:
I am by no means an expert in Vietnamese cuisine. But I do know when I find a place that I like and Sunflower is exactly that.

We walked in on the latish side, which I still feel bad about as they were about to close. I made it a point that if it was too late that we would be more than happy to come back again, but the staff was insistent that we take a seat.

The menu is vast and everything from the sea bass vermicelli dishes all sound absolutely out of this real kick butt. I wanted to order one of everything and then go back for seconds.

Sizzling seafood (which came out as advertised) and the garlic chicken are both solid choices. The spicy green beans were a nice find and one order is more than enough for two (three or even four).

Sunflower is small and if I lived in the neighborhood would certainly make this a regular pit stop. It's worth a trek from anywhere in the Bay Area. Bring a pack of hungry friends and share.
author: V B.

description:
I had read about Sunflower's vegan Pho and had to give it a try. Since it's rare to find Pho without meat stock, I was excited to try it out. Perusing the lunch menu, I ordered the #6 special instead since I was feeling kinda hungry. I ordered takeout since I didn't have all the time in the world for lunch. There was a little confusion on the phone about what comes with the #6. I inquired about whether it came with veg soup and veg imperial roll since the menu seems to indicate it's extra. She said "yes yes" in a curt manner. I later found out that my coworker who ordered the chicken, also got the veg soup and roll. 

Upon paying for the order the cashier handed me back my change but not the food. There were several bags of takeout nearby so I didn't want to just grab one. I stood there as she went to walk away. Then points and says "your order". Ok thank you. Would've appreciated handing it to me with maybe a smile. Oh well, customer service may not be their thing here. Thankfully cooking up some good food is.

You get a pretty good amount of food here for $10 after tax with the lunch special. The Hot and Sour soup was delicious! The perfect light but flavorful compliment to the excellent Imperial roll. It's like a large eggroll but so much better. I'm not sure how they get the texture of the roll but it's something you must try if you go here. It by itself is good enough to put up with the rude service. The lemongrass tofu was tasty but needed some sauce to liven it up. I may try the vermicelli next time.

On my second visit I got the Noodle soup. It's a huge bowl of veggies, broth, and noodles. If you get it to go, it will come in three separate containers that you combine. It definitely hit the spot on a cold 'n rainy day in The City. Same lady taking the order on the phone, same result.

Do to its location and available parking, I'm sure I'll make this another semi-regular lunch stop. I just wish they had a few more veg items on the lunch menu. Also, maybe they could try out some customer service training.
author: John B.

description:
It was my first time coming here last weekend and I'll definitely be back!  We had a party of 8 so the wait was really long, but they eventually sat us in the booth at the back so we had our own privacy which was great.

Vermicelli bowls were really big and tasty, and only ~$8!  Tiger prawns over garlic noodles were my favorite dish (apparently my friend's fav dish too!).  Viet crepe was interesting ... didn't think the french coffee was as good as some other Viet places I've been to.

Overall price was really good.  We way over-ordered, and still each person only paid ~$23.  Expected a lot more from this kind of food.  I liked the overall experience.
author: Cal C.

description:
The food is pretty good, and definitely a great value. You can get a lot of food for a very reasonable price, and $4 glass of wine in SF is hard to come by! I love their spring rolls.

That said, I recommend doing take-out, as the main priority of the servers here seems to be rushing you to finish your meal and leave, so it's not the most enjoyable dining experience. Plus, they are QUICK. I ordered take out, and it was ready in well under 10 minutes. Downside, they don't really seem interested in slowing things down if you prefer a more leisurely meal in their dining room.
author: Alison E.

description:
One of the best Asian/ Vietnamese food I've had. They know their sauces. It's powerful. Its intense. Definitely worth going out of your way to this neighborhood restaurant and waiting in line. 
My only criticism is the noise level. It's like being in a concrete box with a lot of people and kinda the usual Asian restaurant service. It's definitely nicer decor than their old mission location but it was a truly divey place. 

I give this place my 4 stars.
author: Foodie4sf E.

description:
Located in a quiet Potrero neighborhood, Sunflower is away from all the hustle and bustle of the city. The restaurant itself is very small, cozy, and decorated with more of a modern direction. 

The food selection was pretty good. There were a lot of vegetarian options for the veg heads out there, which is really great. I decided to order the vermicelli noodle dish with shrimp here. I thought it was quite good. 

If you're in the neighborhood, I can see how this can be a go to spot, but I've honestly had better; however, I do plan on coming back to try their other popular dishes in the near future. I will be sure to keep y'all updated.
author: Ann S.

description:
This place is delish! I am a fan of their five spice chicken vermicelli. That's how I found this place as it was listed on the Big Eat 2014's list of 100 dishes to go try in SF.

The seating process is a little hectic as the waiters won't make a judgment of how to seat you and will have to wait until the manager. I can see how customers can perceive the staff as unfriendly as they are a bit brusque talking to people, but you just need to talk to them and you will see how friendly they are. My tablemates joked with the staff about cutting the fresh coconut open and the waitress chided to just use your hands to chop it open. Hahaha.
The waiter also joked about charging 5$ to close the door because of the draft. People should take it light with the staff here, they are super nice.

The good: five spice chicken with vermicelli and imperial rolls. The combo appetizer was really delicious though a little bit unwieldy to wrap ourselves with the rice paper they provide. (Everything in it was tasty though!)

We also got the clay pot special and the house special fried rice. I have to say most Asian restaurants that cook fried rice usually tend to over salt it as that's what most people are accustomed to, but the fried rice here was not salty but still flavorful - mad props for knowing how to cook proper fried rice.

This place does not look like a pho place and I would recommend getting the vermicelli anyway.

Would definitely recommend this place for anyone who loves Vietnamese rice dishes!
author: Jeffrey Q.

description:
This place is a total surprise.  I was told about it by a coworker who used to live in the area.  It's a bit up the hill for those who walk there, but it's a great mini-uphill workout for the legs.  

Food: A

Flavors are good; not sure why other people say it's bland.  Maybe they care to cook better for the lunch crowd, because they are always full when I go there.  I've ordered the crab fried rice, egg rolls, summer rolls, and garlic noodles, and they are all great.  Also, the portions are pretty good.  

I don't eat here; I always only get takeout.  They always offer me water while I wait, and fill it without me even asking.  That's a plus in my opinion.
author: Frederick L.

description: My daughter took us to this place and may I say , fabulous place . Clean , location, friendly and fast service all great . I'll be Back !!!
author: Joe L.

description: I've always been a huge fan of Sunflower so I decided to take a good friend who I had not seen in a long time. Dinner was very good as always. Typically because I live so close, I order out but thought eating there would be nice and it was until 9:30pm. Apparently that is closing time because they turned all the lights on suddenly in the dimly lit dining room. It was so rude! As if to say ok we are glad we have your money, now leave. Like a high school dance or something. I've worked as a server and remember many nights working well beyond close as we waited for customers who were enjoying their meal and their company finish. I won't be returning if I can't expect to finish my meal before being rushed out.
author: Vickie B.

description:
What a great, underhyped little spot in Potrero Hill! Definitely get their house salad, which instead of lettuce has shredded cabbage and a tangy dressing. Note that their well loved Shrimp on Garlic Noodles has the shell on. The Shaken Beef is great and rather sweet.

Super friendly service. Try getting a table next to the windows for a fun view of colorful characters getting off the #10 bus.
author: Christina M.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place!! Pho Soup = A+ Flavor, needs nothing extra. Soup is perfection. Imperial Rolls are my fav!! You cant go wrong, their authentic flavor and freshness is everything!! Vermicelli with Tofu is another go-to of mine. I can go on... Love the location too, my window seat is lovely & refreshing.
author: Tee S.

description: This is my reference pho in SF. It's delicious. They just call it beef noodle soup, but they know what you mean whatever you call it. Other items are great too, their garlic noodles are very rich and buttery, an absolute indulgence. The imperial rolls are crispy and savory. But the crab and corn soup, only on the dinner menu, is an unassuming delight. You have to get the shaken beef too. The service starts surly, but then they become very warm and inviting once you've crossed the child-management-heroics barrier.
author: Jamil M.

description: Really not very good. Staff is pretty rude too but I could deal with that if the food wasn't bland and greasy. Prices aren't bad, they give you a lot of food, it's just not very good.
author: Jay B.

description: So many sauces with so much flavor! Best Vietnamese food with reasonable lunch combo prices. I'll be fantasizing about the garlic noodles for a long time.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Quick, tasty, efficient - perfect place for a one hour lunch

We went for a quick lunch, and that is what we got. The spice chicken with noodles and rolls was excellent. The noodles were good and didn't stick together too much like some places. The chicken was not fatty, and the portion size was good. 

We were in and out within 45 minutes.
author: Jon H.

description:
Yes yes yes- If you are looking for a home cooked vietnamese dish that is flavorful.
Their cozy red ethnic vibe  adds to it tastefully.  
The service is decent- Very efficient but minimally friendly. Simple expectations in any small asian restaurant in SF
author: Lynn J.

description:
parking?  i went during lunch time and lost 3 spots in a row to someone else but still found one up the street.  I don't think its always going to be that easy...so expect to park and walk a block i'm assuming.

its right on the corner of 18th and connecticut.

i'm a fan.  its not authentic vietnamese food but its very good.  we came out with the shaking beef, garlic noodles, and imperial rolls.  4 imperial rolls cut in half for 7.50, is a little higher(very tasty) than i'm used to.  the shaking beef was around 13.50, a little higher than i'm used to also, but ALSO very tasty.

the garlic noodles are about the same price 8.50, add beef, chicken for 3 dollars, or 4 pieces of shrimp for 3.  or another few dollars for mixed veggies.  There is a GREAT serving of garlic noodles.  Enough for 2 'heavy' eaters, 3 normal eaters, 4 small portion eaters..or just one really hungry person.

oh one last thing.  every table was full at lunch time 12:15 and people were waiting for a seat.  i counted 5 women total.  um, why are there so many guys?  lol. I don't assume they were all gay, i'm just saying there were a lot of guys there.  LMAO!
author: Bing D.

description:
The portions are enormous. We were able to get a table right before 20 other people came in. We got the garlic noodles with vegetables, steamed sea bass and the 5 spice chicken. Just one of those would have been enough for 2 people. 

The noodle dish came out first, and I thought it was big until I saw the entree size at another table. Good lord that could be 3 meals for one person. 

Service was a little harried because there was only 1 waiter when everyone came in at once, but he was apologetic and nice about it.  Prices were reasonable for the portion sizes, and It's close so I'm sure we'll be back.
author: Seong P.

description:
I'll bump up my rating to 4 stars because this is a really nice restaurant (compared to the dingy Mission location), and u get good value for your money - most items are under $8 for lunch, and many are under $10 for dinner (seafood costs a bit more).

I was tempted to keep the original 3 stars rating, but I believe that a new restaurant deserves a chance to improve. So I'm hopeful that they can manage to iron out some minor issues with food service, explained below.

Obviously since the place is new, it's nicer and cleaner than the location on Valencia street. They've kept the layout and decor from the previous tenant Baraka. So they also inherited the same design flaw, a one person bathroom (back right corner, next to private dining table). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunflower-potrero-hill-san-francisco?select=MtM9OVSb2d0BeihKN-WDXA#MtM9OVSb2d0BeihKN-WDXA Might be a long wait for the bathroom, when the restaurant is full. You've been warned.

Overall the food is good (note that I prefer the Vietnamese places on Larkin street). 

The one flaw that I saw with food service was the inability of the kitchen to keep up with orders with a half full restaurant. Also they couldn't deliver all the food for a table at the same time. I saw 4 or 5 tables were only one person had their plate, while their companion was still waiting for food. Apparently the kitchen was not checking the ticket orders, and just making whatever dishes were easier to make.

In my case, they took a long time to make my BBQ pork combination. While 2 tables that came after me got their food first (they had noodle soup bowls and crispy egg noodles). When I finally got my huge plate of food, I noticed that the pork was cold and only the soup was hot. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunflower-potrero-hill-san-francisco?select=z_UCw1oxvvGyIYUVeerHsA#z_UCw1oxvvGyIYUVeerHsA

My guess is that the grill person did his/her part of cooking the pork, then the plate was misplaced. Later someone found it after most of the orders were gone, and got the soup person to complete the set. Therefore, I can only conclude that they have a very disorganized kitchen. I'll revise my review if this doesn't improve.
author: Luis C.

description:
I really really wanted to give this place 5 stars since it's in my hood. We've been ordering take out here for close to 5 years and have eaten here a few times and the food is of great quality but the service just is too lacking. 

To be honest I don't have high expectations in terms of service for any down home Asian restaurant but for take out if your order Pho it's a good chance you won't get Siracha or hoisin sauce if you don't remind them.

If you eat in then you at least get everything you want except be sure to order appetizers first then have them go place that order and wait to place your entree order or else you'll get your entrees then appetizers in the middle of the meal. 

That being said the food quality is pretty good for the area.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Okay so: 

Fresh

Clean

Delicious 

Spring Shrimp Roll 
Pho Ga (Chicken Vermicelli Soup) 

Great service

Great location (PoHill - what great views and hills)

Just shut up and go there.
author: Sanaz E.

description:
After spending the morning playing at Recess with my son and his godmother we were starving.  We decided to drive down a couple of blocks and settled on Sunflower and I'm so glad we did!   

The restaurant is in a cute area and there are a few restaurants and a cute bakery around the same couple of blocks.  

We were seated immediately and offered water right away.  I checked out the other patrons food while they were being delivered to their tables and the portions were HUGE.  We settled on the garlic noodles and the lemongrass shrimp with brown rice.  I also ordered a Thai ice tea and my friend had the ice coffee. 

The garlic noodles were delicious and so was the lemongrass shrimp!  I will so return since the prices were reasonable and it's super close to my son's play place.  Love it.
author: Christine P.

description:
My partner and I really enjoy dining at the Sunflower In Potrero Hill. The Portereo Hill Space is much cleaner than the Sunflower in the Mission, and that's the main reason why we dine here. The food is greasy, but delicious. However, I dined here yesterday, and the service was horrible!!! Wait...let me rephrase that: The service here is #LetMeTakeACrap. There are many reasons why my partner and I won't be coming back to dine here. 

First, the male waiter rushed us to order drinks and food as if they were going to be super busy on a Tuesday night. Really? I sat down at our table, and my partner went to use the restroom. (BTW, the sink water is hot...hot...hot. Please call the plumber as suggested by an Anonymous person on the note you posted on the wall.) Sorry for the non-sequitur.  Immediately, the male waiter asked me what I wanted to drink and what my partner wanted to drink. Excuse me? Do I look like I can read my partner's mind, while he's taking a piss??? 

Second, somehow our male waiter disappeared in the middle of our dinner, and a female waiter came up to our table and asked us to box our food? Excuse me? Do I look like I was done stuffing my face??? 

Third, the male waiter reappeared and took the cash from our table without even asking us if we needed change. Excuse me? I wasn't going to give you that 20% Tip. 

And last, the leftovers that the female waiter boxed did not include all the leftovers.  Excuse me? Did she eat my noodles or did she feed them to the dogs??? 

Ya need to CHANGE ya's service. Please go to Change.org to start a petition on yourself!!!
author: Kiki L.

description:
Great food and I choose the stars for food only. Service is not so great, so just be aware of that - takeout is a great option! 

I'd recommend lunch there too! Great specials!
author: Jessica G.

description: I stopped going here because, even though the staff is very friendly and they treated us like royalty, their food was just not getting better. I hate to write them a negative review, but they just need fresher, better tasting food.
author: Rodrigo P.

description: The woman who answers the phone and does takeout was rude to me twice! She is not very friendly. Not coming back.
author: Mike M.

description:
What a cute, clean, reasonably priced place!  After perusing the menu and checking in with my tummy, I opted for a bowl of chicken pho. It took awhile to get, and, to be perfectly honest, I was starting to regret my decision when my friend's dish arrived and mine was nowhere to be seen. BUT, after a few more minutes, mine came out and...drumroll please...the pho was really top notch.  This wasn't your typical bowl of ridiculously hot broth with a solid ball of lukewarm noodles that you have to separate out yourself (you know what I'm talking about).  The bowl here was a good size, the noodles and accompaniments (basil, etc) were fresh, the broth was flavorful, and there was more than enough white chicken breast meat.  I slurped it up happily, especially the little bits of crispy onions that they put in there...mmmmm!! 

Parking is generally also easy and free.
author: Janet Z.

description:
If you love garlic order the Garlic Noodles with your choice of meat or veggie.. delicious. The chicken noodle soup and the Imperial Rolls are good too. But if you had to try one thing order the Garlic Noodles.

Service is on point, if you're a stickler for drink refills before your cup is dry they do a good job with that.  It can get real busy for lunch 11:30am so get there around 11:15am before the neighbors get there. If there is no room try Papito across the street..excellent food as well.
author: Chief D.

description:
Again, I love the Potrero for the easy access from the peninsula and the parking.

It was pretty full at Sunflower on a random Tuesday night, and then when tables opened up, they still insisted that we wait for the whole party of 4 to be seated (2 of us were present).  I guess I understand because it's a small space, but still.. standing by the door was no fun when there were plenty of tables open.  I did run into a friend there randomly, who frequents Sunflower as his go to Vietnamese place.

Most of us had vermicelli bowls, which were just ok (I'm not that far from San Jose, so the bar has been set pretty high).  The vermicelli bowl was largely vermicelli and not enough vegetables, and the "prawns" in mine were pretty sad/small.  The imperial rolls were greasy but good and substantial, even better with fish sauce.  The stir fried chicken noodles were actually better than the vermicelli bowl (large strips of chicken breast, lots of vegetables), and I would get this on a future trip.

It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing.. maybe we tried the wrong things?  It's not expensive, and it's a convenient location, and it's pretty clean.
author: Marilyn H.

description: I came for dinner with a party of 3 and asked to be seated away from the open door since it was cold.  I was told that it was reserved for parties of 4. Then, we were seated at table for 4 directly in front of the door.  Since they wouldn't accommodate our seating request, I asked if they could close the door curtain and the server said, "no - people won't know we're open if we do that, which begs the question, "why do they even have the curtain if they're not going to use it?" The food came rather quickly but was nothing to write home about. We had the shaken beef, garlic veggies and pho.  I liked the pho the best but the meal was a little pricey because of the neighborhood it's in.
author: Shir K.

description:
(See pic)

Finally tried out this Sunflower and must say this is my favorite location.

It's quite a busy place for lunch but many eat and leave so the wait was not bad. You will see policemen, folks from tech companies nearby, and a bunch of locals around. 

We waited for about 10 minutes and the shorter wait was because they actually have this private room on the side that has the bright red curtains. They rolled open the red velvet curtains revealing the super comfy and plushy red velvet seating, with a lovely and pretty colorful stained glass lantern hanging low that one of my colleague joked that it was quite romantic! Of course I forgot to take a picture of the setting but you should check it out if you go there.

The fact that they made that available without losing customers earned that extra bright red star.

The food was very delicious and in generous portions. I had the beef vermicelli that also came with the freshly deep fried Imperial rolls. It was so much food that I had to take half of it home for dinner.

AND it's only $10 including tip.

The service was right on and prompt.
author: T L.

description:
Yummy authentic Vietnamese food. The shrimp spring rolls, the beef pho, and grilled pork bun were all exactly as I imagined - delicious, refreshing, and full of flavor. 

My only gripe was having my light meal marred by the greasy, deep-fried imperial roll in my bun. I will look for an alternative next time, since this thing truly does not belong in a rice noodle dish. Ick.

Coming back next time I'm in this part of town!
author: Fiona Y.

description: Chicken spice rice plate is amazing ! This place is all around 5 star. Great food, nice atmosphere, well designed interior.
author: Alexander R.

description:
This restaurant has always been a delight.  I have been for lunch and for dinner and the meal is simply superb every single time.  My favorite part is the staff always recognized and greet me warmly whenever I enter and make me laugh.  It's a friendly atmosphere and the setting is elegant.

Love it.  One of my favorite neighborhood gems.
author: Mikael B.

description:
GARLIC NOODLES WITH PRAWNS - $15

Definitely worth every penny. It's kind of pricey for lunch, but the portions are HUGE! They provide huge pieces of prawn (not shrimp!) and tons of noodles. I had to take more than half of the dish home so I could share with my boyfriend.

It's a small restaurant but they can accomodate large groups. We had a group of 8 and we only had to wait for several minutes. I also saw another group of 13 which got seated almost immediately. 

The venue gets packed around lunch time, though, so beware and get here early.
author: Heather R.

description:
Meh. Food was edible but not great. Garlic noodles just tasted like chow mein that someone threw some garlic on as an afterthought. They didn't have v that deep garlicky yumminess you'd expect from other Vietnamese places. 

The waitress kept bumping into me with no apology but then suddenly got nice when she dropped the bill. 

I love this neighborhood though!
author: Victoria W.

description: The food is mediocre. It is hit or miss. I had some good dishes and some that are not memorable. This place is good for a quick and inexpensive meal. The service is not professional and rude. My 6 YO was not allowed to sit at the banquet seating even though the restaurant was empty: this was Saturday night at 6:30. The reason was "kids have accidents and will make the seating wet". So we left. Now I know that this neighborhood restaurant is not kid friendly!
author: Missy W.

description: We went to this restaurant based on some reviews on yelp.... But this restaurant is really not good at all - we ordered the hot and sour soup - it was pineapple and some tomato and water - very clear soup and no taste.  Garlic noodles were very oily and we added the beef - you can just taste the quality of food is poor... Lemongrass chicken is the same - very dry and the ingredients are very low quality.....  We weren't looking for something fancy but it shocks me that something so low quality can survive in that neighborhood.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Food is decent and the price is average for the (pricy) Potrero Hill neighborhood.  I have had better and cheaper Vietnamese food at other places but was stuck in the area and there are not much choices.  I had the Five Spice Chicken Bun which is pretty standard dish.  Flavor was lacking and the pieces were not cut bite size.  My friend had the Pho and it was just average, nothing to rave about.  Spend the time and drive to other neighborhoods for better cheaper fare.
author: barry w.

description: This is a cute little restaurant. I ordered the chicken garlic noodles. Their portions are really generous.
author: Christina C.

description:
Was looking for a quick bite to eat on Potrero Hill and Sunflower here had a pretty decently priced menu so we gave it a try. 

However, it took awhile for us to be seated which meant we had to awkwardly wait in the door/outside until the waitress seated us. Our table was nice, close to the window but we were so close to the other tables that we could hear everyone's conversations.... It was also VERY loud inside the restaurant making it extremely difficult to hear anything my boyfriend was saying, and he was only a couple feet away! We ordered the pan fried noodles (combination) and the BBQ pork vermicelli bowl. 

My pan fried noodles were decent. They lacked flavor so I needed to add chili sauce on top to punch it up but at least there were a variety of vegetables (cauliflower, broccoli, zucchini, squash, mushrooms) and a good amount of chicken. The plate was also really huge so I ended up with a take away box after dinner because I couldn't finish it. My BF's BBQ pork was really good!! It had a lot of flavor so I kind of wish I had ordered something that included the pork... His meal also had the thin, white noodles on the bottom with some cucumber as well as one of the imperial rolls on top with a side of dipping sauce. 

Service was a bit sketchy here.... There were only three servers for the entire restaurant so it was very difficult to flag someone down when I needed chili sauce or when we wanted the check. Overall the food we ordered was just okay, at least the dishes were better priced than some of the other nearby restaurants but I don't think I would return here for dinner. However I saw some pictures on Yelp that showed a pretty delicious looking lunch special!
author: Sam F.

description: The garlic noddles with the prawns is what you should order the next time you visit this restaurant, it is trully amazing! Portions are big and the quality of the food is excellent. Service was great as well, very attentive. Price wise, it is easy on the wallet, no crazy prices for the amount of food they give you. If you are in Potrero Hill area stop by.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I've never come here and been disappointed.  I've always been seated right away.  Don't get me wrong, they aren't super empty inside - they normally have plenty of customers.  Somehow, they always seem to have seating!

I always order the Combination Pho here, though I've seen the other plates and they all look delicious.  The best seat in the house is directly next to the window.  You can people-watch and get the fresh breeze from outside as you sip on your pho.

Great service - your water cup will always stay full.  All in all, I'd definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who'd want to pickup a quick Vietnamese meal.  Also a great restaurant after a long night out, especially if you don't want to wait in the long line at Plow for brunch.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Ever eat a meal knowing that it is going taste even better the next day reheated and eaten on your couch in your PJs watching HGTV all day?  No?  Well, maybe that's just me, but that's exactly what I thought about when I took my first bite of my fried rice with prawns, chicken, and pineapple.  Well, maybe not the first bite.  It did need a bit more flavor, but once I got some of the sweet seafood sauce, that second bite sold me.

Sunflower is close to my cousin's house and one of his favorite places to eat, so when my husband and I came into town, it was the first restaurant he took us too.  The portions were enormous and the place itself was quaint and decorated simply, yet beautifully.  The small red room had a giant, black cast-iron candle chandelier in the center and there were candles in little cut-outs in the wall.

Between the group of us, we ordered the sea bass (which was very light and in great, flavorful sauce) and the garlic noodles and prawns.  Sunflower is known for its garlic noodles which everyone raves about.  Although popular, I am glad I didn't get it. When I tried it, it was too much for me.  Definitely for garlic-loves only.

It's a great little place in a great little part of Potrero with some of the BIGGEST meals I saw in San Francisco, especially for the price.  My advice?  Come hungry and make sure you pack up what you don't eat.  You will love it even more tomorrow.
author: Elsa M.

description:
A mark of a tried and true restaurant is their consistency. This place keeps their menu relatively concise and their portions and quality keeps my appetite and wallet happy. I'm not in Potrero often, but when I think of Vietnamese in SF, this quaint little joint comes first to mind.

Keep serving up the great grub, Sunflower! Best garlic noodles hands down; get it with their Sunflower prawns and you won't be disappointed.
author: Bruce M.

description:
My friends and I have been weekly regulars here for 2-3 years. There are two main reasons we consistently come back here:

-Garllc noodles - This is the golden ticket; we have tried garlic noodles from a lot of vietnamese places around the Bay area (e.g. PPQ) and nothing compares. The garlic flavor is strong and infused (i.e. not tossed with garlic seasoning or chunks of garlic cloves). The noodles are firm without being hard, and soft without being limp.

-Beef noodle soup - Essentially pho but they don't call it that. My friends and I have crawled through numerous pho places in the area. It's the consistency and strong flavor that drives our craving for this. Is it the best of the best? Maybe not but it's a solidly good dish that becomes a staple craving after awhile.

The staff is very nice and hustle around with efficiency. Also a huge plus is how clean the place is - something that for me plays an important part of the experience.

I'd rave on but basically this is why I've gone to this restaurant more than any other restaurant in the city in my ~4 years of living here.
author: Raymond C.

description: Compared to other "authentic" Vietnamese restaurants, the food was a little bland.  I was expecting basil in my vermicelli, but got lettuce instead which really killed it for bland taste.  Imperial rolls were not flavorful.  Food was pretty forgettable. This place is just mediocre, not awesome.
author: Pose M.

description: Great Vietnamese spot that has all of the normal fare (imperial rolls, bun, BBQ pork) as well as the more deep cut offering (crepe). Fast but good service, reasonably price, good quality food = 4 stars.
author: Tracy L.

description: The food here is delicious! The Phó is super amazing! The service was definitely 2 stars tonight though.
author: Mac D.

description:
Totally amazing place ... I love the interior all red... Service is great... I love how fast they are... 

Spring rolls = fresh and delicious 
Steak pho = omg so amazing ; beef is just right ... Giant red onions.. Bomb ... Broth is amazing ... 

Vietnamese ice coffee = mega bomb 

Chicken fried rice = really amazing .....

I like this place a lot

Parking is a little hard 

But worth it... Always a go to ...
author: Faith C.

description:
You serious right now?!?  Four stars??  WOW!!  Horrible food!!

I have tried many, many Vietnamese food.  Even had authentic Vietnamese cuisine in Vietnam.  This place is by far thee worst I have ever tried in the Bay.  Their garlic noodles didn't have much garlic in it.  The noodles itself felt like 3-day old noodles that was just microwaved for a few minutes when I bite into the soggy, mushy noodles.

Really disappointed with all the Yelpers out their that gave them a high ranking.  Just ridiculous...
author: Patrick C.

description:
Really solid Vietnamese food in Potrero Hill. The pho here is flavorful, and the BBQ pork vermicelli bowl always hits the spot. Prices are reasonable, service is efficient, no complaints here.

One particularly nice thing about Sunflower is that there's rarely ever a line to be seated, which is a welcome reprieve from the other (also great) restaurants on that 18th street drag which always have Coachella-sized crowds milling about out front during peak dining hours.

Yay Sunflower!
author: Sabrina V.

description: Great go to place for lunch. I love their food! Especially their combo lunch specials and garlic noodles.. Not the best place for pho.. They don't have the authentic cuts of meat that I like in my pho. But definitely a good place to eat..
author: Rochell S.

description:
Couldn't tell that this place was Pho until I walked inside. From the outside it appears to look like any other establishment, particularly a flower shop.

GOOD:
The pho broth tastes clean. The basil and bean sprouts are also clean. They wash them. Beef quality was lean. The imperial roll appetizer is very good. Crispy, flaky wrap, and a fish sauce mixed with chili sauce so it doesn't taste fishy. It is a lot for one person. Recommend sharing unless this is your meal.

BAD:
Only couple of pho options, and the menus says Noodle soups. And only one size option, which was way too much for me. I am used to eating small pho.

FAV:
Imperial Roll


1-star: I've had hemorrhoids more pleasant than this. 
2-star: I would rather avoid this place. 
3-star: On par with other similar establishments. 
4-star: Will return as often as possible. 
5-star: I refuse to find a better place.
author: Caleb F.

description:
I'm just the IT guy and taste tester. My wife writes all the cools stuff


The other week I went to Sunflower in Potrero Hill with some friends.  It was only my second time really having Vietnamese food.  The place was slammed on a Wednesday evening, and we had to wait about fifteen minutes to get a table.  A line of people continued to form waiting for tables to open.

We ordered some shrimp spring rolls to start.  They came with the traditional peanut dipping sauce.  The rolls themselves were standard, nothing outstanding about them, but they weren't terrible.

For my main I went with the Beef Noodle Soup, known as Pho.  A friend also decided on Vegetable Noodle Soup.  Basically, Pho is a beef broth based soup with rice noodles and meat.  Bean sprouts, chili, and basil are served on the side and you add them to the hot soup.  The beef is thinly shaved/sliced, so very tender.  I also added mixed vegetables to my Pho.  The bowl was humongous and probably had about a pound of noodles in it.  It was also full of vegetables and beef.  Definitely a great deal.  The flavor is amazing, slightly sweet with savory, brothy goodness.  It was a cold, windy night in San Francisco, so it was comforting and warming.

My other two friends each ordered Curry Chicken, which included mixed vegetables in a coconut curry sauce.  Their plates were enormous too.  It was definitely sharable.  It smelled delicious and had a nice subtle coconut flavor without being overwhelming.  It also smelled quite spicy, but the spice had great depth of flavor without being overpowering.

I will definitely be going back to get more Pho, or try one of their other dishes.  But, I think I'll share a dish next time.
author: Chad G.

description: What a great  place. Was seated  quickly  even though it was very busy. I ordered  the soup with beef. As someone  who has eaten pho and soups restaurant and home made, this was great food.  Very flavorful and plenty of beef. The broth was perfect. The staff is friendly and I will definitely  be going back.
author: J B.

description: I'm really baffled by the 4 and 5 star reviews of this place.  My only guess is that the reviewers are not familiar with real authentic Vietnamese food?  I moved to this neighborhood earlier this year and really wanted to like this place.  I gave it three tries, each time trying something different but the food was always a dissapointment.  I'm Vietnamese and grew up in the South Bay so maybe my standards for authentic Vietnamese food are higher than average, but still .. it was sub-average at best.  I've never had any issue with the service though, they've always been friendly and efficient.  I just wish the food was better so I wouldn't have to travel so far to satisfy my Vietnamese food cravings.
author: My N.

description:
Pretty good Vietnamese food
A bit Americanized with their plethora of fried food options ( Garlic prawns, fried tofu, imperial rolls, fried crepe) but there are some lighter options like the pho and brown rice substitutes 
We had the fried tofu, veg imperial rolls, beef pho and crepes
Everything was pretty tasty but the pho was bit over Salted and wasn't boiling hot as one may expect of typical authentic Vietnamese restaurants 
Deco was a tad off- Moroccan?
Overall good food and passing service 
Good choice for quick bite to quench your Vietnamese fix while in Potrero hill
author: CJ P.

description: I've ordered take-out twice.  Spring rolls were bland and tasteless.  Shaking Beef ... really that was beef?  Garlic noodles, curried eggplant, lemongrass chicken ... blech.
author: Steve C.

description: One of my favorite local places. I have yet to have anything I didn't like, though being creatures of habit get the garlic noodles and BBQ pork vermicelli more than half the times we go there. The service is excellent and sometimes I stop in just for an iced coffee on my way home. Highly recommended if you are in this neck of the woods!
author: Carolina A.

description:
My wife and I have been coming here for years and have appreciated the very good food and service.

That was until yesterday when the host told us (party of 2) we needed to wait for a table, even though there were a couple of larger tables (seats 4 people) available and no one else waiting for a table.  15 minutes went by, an additional table (for 4 people) opened up, and we remained the only party in line.  Finally, when a group of 4 came by (no reservation), they were seated right away, and we were still told that we had to wait.  By that point, we had enough and told the host that we would find another restaurant, and he didn't even apologize for the inconvenience.

We were stunned that the restaurant would keep 3 tables open on the chance that they might have larger parties walk in and risk the business of one very loyal customer.  We will not be coming back.
author: Nicholas H.

description: This place was decent. First it is not really a Vietnamese place, but rather a Chinese Vietnamese place. You can tell by the flavor. Second the brown rice isn't brown, but rather red rice. (Red rice is cheaper than brown rice) Third I had the worst case of diarrhea ever!
author: Hien P.

description:
I went to dinner there last night with a date.  I ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli.

The noodles were way small, and the chicken had skin and other parts which I decided not to eat.

I went to use the restroom and it was gross.

I got a stomach ache after eating there.
author: Puzzik f.

description: I am so sad the Sunflower on Mission closed and I literally drive from the north of the city to Potrero Hill for food here. My faves: garlic noodles. Hands down, best garlic noodles in the city. Better than Thanh Long, PPQ, any of the places in Little Saigon. Shaken beef - chunks of filet pre marinated and bursting with flavor. Really tender and lean. Bbq pork  - moist (yes, I used that word) and also very flavorful.   This place is the only reason why I venture down to Potrero. None of the other places do it for me.
author: Deal G.

description:
VEGETARIANS BEWARE.  Their "vegetarian" dishes are anything but...they use fish products is nearly all of their "vegetarian" dishes which is just ridiculous, especially in SF.  And they say they cannot make the dish without using those meat products.  How tf is this "vegetarian"?  Most ridiculous thing I've come across in a restaurant.

Aside from the rude service I get when calling in (when I used to order from here), it's just a huge disappointment when you just can't trust a restaurant's food.  I've been vegetarian my entire life and have only eaten meat accidentally three times...this would be #3.

If you eat meat/fish, then I'm sure this place will suit you well.  Also this is not a rant on Vietnamese restaurants in general as I've been to many in the city that are excellent.
author: Sagar G.

description:
My first time at Sunflower made me smile :) My colleague and I stopped in for lunch and I had the Vermicelli noodles with shrimp and imperial rolls. I enjoyed the nicely seasoned grilled shrimp. It all tasted nice and fresh to order. Under $10 for a big bowl of flavor - I think that's darn good! 
Seating is tight but it's ok for a small place. A single bathroom. Staff was nice and quick to get your order to you. I'll make sure to try out the sauces next time.
author: Charlene K.

description:
Game Changer: Lemon Grass Beef And Garlic Noodles.

I originally gave this place a 3.5 as one of those vietnamese town kids, but now I think it deserves a whole lot more loving after trying two new dishes.

Garlic Noodles: I kid you not, this is a mountain of noodles, if you add chicken or another meat, consider this a DOUBLE MOUNTAIN. It's more than enough for 3 people no doubt. Garlic-y, savory, thin spaghetti like noodles mixed with white meat chicken. Simple, easy, filling, yum. but - don't expect veggies or a garnish.

Lemon Grass Beef: A very generous serving of green beans, red chili peppers, onions, sauteed with beef in a lemon grass sauce. What I liked about this dish is that everything wasn't overcooked -- the green beans were crunchy and the beef slightly rare still.


PS. $10 card minimum.
author: Christine B.

description:
Great pho in portrero hill, make sure to order the imperial eggrolls and beef noodle soup! Broth was soothing and rich atypical to what you'd expect from a pho place where 80-90% of the people that dine here are white. 

Eggrolls are delicious and crispy.. One rare thing about this place is the abundance of parking
author: James H.

description: Super yummy and reasonably priced...I love the chicken salad (cool, crunchy and sweet) and the garlic eggplant (great flavor)...
author: Sandy K.

description:
* food was average (coming from a vietnamese person that grew up in the bay area)
* staff was not friendly and never came by to see if we needed anything else (had to walk up and get our own condiment/sauce)
author: Tina F.

description: Worst experience ever. Tables are less than a foot from each other had some Radom ppl talking In my ear. Difficulty ordering noodles why can't I have noodles? Wtf will never ever come her again. Empty tables and they want to put me next to literary next to might as well have been the same table as two other ppl. Salty salty beef lemmongrass
author: Chenea P.

description:
I'm pretty picky when it comes to fried rice, to the point of "nope never ordering fried rice from anywhere ever" snobbery, but I was craving it + feeling lazy so I gave their House Fried Rice a try. Their addition of pineapple is a yummy touch. It did not disappoint -- you get a giant plate (3 meal's worth, probably) of fluffy, if somewhat slightly oily, fried rice with a really good balance of chicken + veggies. 

We got the crepe as an appetizer. I'm used to Vietnamese crepes being more crepe-like, by which I mean you should be able to fold the thing up into a neat parcel and eat it on the go like a French crepe. Sunflower's version is more like a Vietnamese taco? ?? ? ?? in the sense that the crepe is really crispy/fried. However, it was good all the same, especially when wrapped up in lettuce and hastily shoved into your mouth before it loses its structural integrity. 

The beef pho's not bad. I was really impressed by the variety of veggies they threw into it at our request of "extra vegetables" though -- red bell pepper and cauliflower and zucchini and a bunch of other goodies all up in that bowl.
author: Angela N.

description:
This place gives you a lot of food. I got the combo egg noodles and it filled an entire elliptical plate. My friends experienced the same difficulty finishing their meals. The price is right too, even without considering the portions. Total only came to $47 for 4 dishes and an appetizer.

This is not a huge place though and there's a non-existent waiting area. People that choose to wait inside are likely going to be just a couple feet from someone else's table and food. Fortunately Potrero Hill has pretty agreeable weather most of the time.
author: Jason C.

description: This is my go to Vietnamese spot in the city. I alternate between three things here : the beef pho, pork vermicelli , and hot and sour soup . They are all delicious!!!
author: Chantel B.

description: Big fan!! I love pho and I can honestly say that the beef pho I had here was the best pho I've ever had--and I just got back from a month long trip to South East Asia (8 days of which were spent in Vietnam). The beef flavor was a total game changer and I definitely appreciated the red onions in there too. The waiter was even nice enough to give me an extra plate of sprouts/basil/jalepenos! (i've been denied this before...so rude). I would definitely come back here if I'm in the area again. Too bad its not close to my work!
author: Rosellen R.

description: Sunflower is hit or miss. I've had some tasty food, but I've also been extremely disappointed. I've given up on trying the pho, because 2/3rds of the time it's not as tasty.
author: Naimah M.

description: Not the nicest waitresses at this place.  we felt kind of rushed when they took our order, even though the place wasn't super busy.  But even with good service, I still only would have given this place two stars.  Any place that just says 'beef pho' on the menu, with out giving you the option pick all the exotic cow pieces you want, doesn't seem that authentic to me.  so I skipped the beef pho and got a veggie pho, which was just veggies boiled in chicken broth.  The kitchen isn't really trying too hard to impress here.
author: James T.

description: Walked in and ordered a bowl of pho in Vietnamese and got blank stares. I suppose it's the best you'll get if you're trapped in Portero Hill.
author: Lan T.

description:
They claim not to use MSG, but I don't really believe them.  Who cares, though?  The garlic noodles are a deal, and they're amazing.  So if you want to experience an amazing garlic-noodles deal, hop on the 10 or the 22 and say to the driver,

"Take me down to the MSG city where the prices are cheap and the noodles are MSGey.  Take.  Me.  Ho-e-ome-oe-oeme!"

Or just sit down and enjoy your strange trip to Potrero Hill.  

Sunflower can have peculiar hours, so make sure you call ahead if you're not sure they're open.  But if you do show up, they might open early for you.  The seating could be more comfortable, but I basically ignore everything except the sweat and garlic oozing from my pores after I've downed an order of the garlic noodles.  If you've got a seating choice, always take one of the window seats overlooking Connecticut Street.
author: John S.

description:
This review is based on two visits -- one for dine-in, one for take-out.

FOOD: 3/5 -- inconsistent. Shaken beef was great both times; garlic noodles were delicious with vegetables on our dine-in visit; but super dry and unappealing on our take-out visit. We also had the shrimp spring rolls, which were good but not outstanding. 

SERVICE: 3/5 -- not particularly friendly on either visit, but efficient. They are fast and seem focused on turning tables, perhaps because we arrived about an hour before close on our dine-in visit. Minus a few points for consistently turning parties away who arrived 30 minutes before the 10pm "closing" time! 

I wouldn't recommend takeout -- I'm not convinced our food was made-to-order... it was literally ready in about 5 minutes after we called; and then was completely cold by the time we were home (just 5 minutes later). 

Given the number of other solid choices in the city, probably won't return after a disappointing take-out experience yesterday.
author: Daniel P.

description:
It's a lot harder to find good pho in SF than it is in the south bay, this is certain. But Sunflower Potrero does a great job, altho they don't call it pho, they call it "noodle soup". I suppose they're catering to the non-Vietnamese folks who frequent this cafe.

The set up is clean and neat, but sort of no-frills. The food comes out quickly and the staff is very friendly. I only wish they did half orders of their food. Everything comes in such large portions which is great for some dishes as I suppose you could take home. However, I wouldn't want to try and take home a half order of the pho. 

Definitely a good option if you're in the neighborhood. I believe they also have one in The Mission. :)
author: Melanie N.

description:
mmmmm

Vegetable Spring Rolls :: Tofu, mushrooms, cabbage, carrots  7.25

^^Huge rolls!

Vegetarian Crepe :: Rice crepe with tofu, mushrooms, bean sprouts, served with mint leaves, greens  8.5 

^^ Interesting..... Ive only eaten togo, so I am actually not to sure how I was supposed to handle eating it. It was delicious, but very messy. 

Vegetarian :: House favorite, mixed vegetables with vegetarian broth  8.25

Crispy Egg Noodles with mixed vegetables:: Tofu & Vegetable :: 7.95  

+++Fresh vegetables, cooked to a nice crisp bite. Not undercooked nor overcooked. 
+++ No MSG.... winning!
+++ Price not to shabby, I am ALWAYS stuffed afterwards
+++ Flavors are fresh and dont taste as if it has been reheated or sat around for hours until order. 

Conclusion: This is by far my fav Vietnamese spot in the city. I live in the inner sunset and when I have the time I order togo. Always worth it.
author: Julia D.

description: Came here during the lunch rush and was extremely pleased with the speed and efficiency of the staff. Not only did the wait staff do a great job with the table, the love that went into the food was apparent. flavorful food served in large portions echoed of family style. Very affordable for the amount of tasty food you get. I will return for some rolls, pho, or one of their many delicious looking (and smelling) rice dishes.
author: Justin C.

description: I loved the hole-in-the-wall Sunflower on Valencia which had school lunchroom ambience but very attentive service and excellent food. When they closed precipitously, we started going to Sunflower on Potrero Hill. The food is almost as good but the service is terrible. They go out of their way to be rude, which is the opposite of the Valencia location. Let's hope they can learn from their mistakes and bring the Valencia servers to the Potrero location and release the rude servers on Potrero to the universe.
