I've only been here once.  Because of the other positive reviews and that fact that I'm around the Dogpatch for lunch time I'll consider coming back to try other offerings.

I had their Pork Vermicelli noodle "salad" with a spring roll substitute and it was average to sub-par.  It was also more expensive than I'm accustomed to at the noodle-houses, but this is a a restaurant, so the comparisons don't translate, but the food should!

Ambiance = nice
Food= jury is still out.
Prices= not bad for a sit down restaurant, but too much if you can't "deliver" on the most basic of Vietnamese dishes.

I'm willing to try them again.
author: MC C.

description: Sunflower is truly a great place.  I have gone here with friends as well as on a date, and it's a nice atmosphere.  Really great food and good service.  They have really good vegetarian options as well.  It's right on the corner of a street and easy to get to.  I always feel that I get my moneys worth.  I am planning to come back next week!
author: Ana M.

description: I love this place for lunch or an afternoon meal. I'm a fan of the natural light and hilltop location as well as the food. The garlic noodles are addictive--the portion is pretty generous, but you'll surprise yourself with how much you will devour. The imperial rolls are crisp and have just the right amount of crunch. The service was quick and efficient when I was there 2:00pm. We like getting take-out, too. For an easy evening meal, I order the garlic noodles with tofu and supplement them with some fresh seasonal produce at home.
author: Daphne J.

description:
Hooray for Sunflower, Potrero Hill!  I usually avoid the Mission location because Princess hates to ride the bus, and also does not enjoy the intense frustration of procuring a home for her chariot in the vicinity.

The new location has a bit of an identity crisis--still all  Baraka on the inside (minus the candles that are glaringly absent from their designated locations on the ceiling and wall fixtures), appearing more Minimalist Middle East than Vibrant Vietnam--but I digress...

This is, after all, about the food, which is pretty darned good standard Vietnamese fare.  The menu offers a nice variety, and the quality of the food is very good.  Service is all smiles--you'd be hard-pressed to find a friendlier waitstaff in the area.  A big plus is the set-up of all two-tops in the main seating area that can be pushed together to accommodate large and even larger groups.  I didn't venture into the back, but it appeared that the large, private curtained booth from the Baraka days was spared in the transition.

Welcome to the neighborhood, Sunflower!
author: Michele W.

description:
18th street in Potrero Hill is a gem of a place for excellent eateries. In the 2 blocks of space that contains both a Chez Maman and a Chez Papa, you really can't go wrong with any of the picks here. Last week, another jewel was added to the mix: Sunflower!

The sister restaurant of Sunflower Authentic Vietnamese in the Mission, this new location provides a more hip and more spacious atmosphere that features the same great food and service. Between the four of us, we had:

Imperial Rolls
Shaken Beef
Lemongrass Chicken
Garlic Noodles with Beef
Vermicelli with Marinated Pork/Spring Rolls

The portions are enough to provide the next day's lunch. I barely made a dent in my vermicelli before I felt uncomfortably full, and pretty much everyone had a to-go box with them at the end. The marinated pork was charbroiled just right (not dry/burnt like some places I've been to). The fish sauce had a little spicy kick to it too, which i really liked. If you're not a vermicelli person like I am, I would recommend all of the other dishes we ordered. Everything was extremely flavorful. The shaken beef was SO tender! I also like the crunch that the green beans gave the lemongrass chicken dish. As for the garlic noodles, you really can't go wrong with that. I wish they had a crab option, but there has been hints that they might do a seasonal crab special in the future. Yum! 

The prices are good and the parking is super easy. 

This is a flower I'll be putting in my bouquet of frequently visited eateries.
author: Rona J.

description: Surprise!! Another great find in Potrero Hill. My friend and I just finished a  swim in burlingame and was heading towards Sportsbasement to buy shoes when we saw this cute place in the area. It finally opened says my friend who lives down the street. We opted to have lunch there. We were seated by the window and immediately was attended to. I had the combo of soup, salad, egg roll, and lemongrass chicken. She had the vegetarian version of mine. Everything was delicious. Will definitely be back to try the other entrees.
author: Mauling W.

description:
Had a late dinner here last night on the recommendation of Kat. Fairly decent prices, good portions (enough for 2-3), nice atmosphere, cool vibes. Melanie and I ordered crab fried rice, spicy green beans with mushrooms, and some veggie imperial rolls. Each and every one of the dishes hit the spot! I washed it all down with some Vietnamese iced coffee so I was pretty much up for the duration of the evening. 

I wanna come back and try their garlic noodles!
author: Ivan F.

description:
One of my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF
The Imperial rolls are so delicious, not at all greasy and my 3 year old son is addicted to them.  Perfectly fine with me because they are loaded with all kinds of veggie goodness. The garlic noodles are seasoned to perfection, buttery and cooked al dente. Not only do they focus on quality but also quantity. I wish you guys would open on Fillmore and give over rated Out the Door a run for it's money.  
5 Stars for:
Fresh ingredients
Amazing service
Great value
Nice decor
Clean restaurant
author: Kristine E.

description:
This is the best Vietnamese food I have ever had in my life! 

My husband grew up in Vietnam and said, this place is authentic. The prices are very affordable under 10.00 for lunch and I would have paid twice that for my lunch special. 

I loved the fresh spring rolls, chicken soup, lemon grass ANYTHING there is amazing and a must try!!!!!

The place is clean, the food is seasoned well and quality ingredients.  I could eat there every week and I will.
author: An honest opinion ..

description:
Sadly, I have to give this restaurant a one star. Their food and staff are ok, prices and location are great. The worst thing about this place is the use of MSG. This is the third time I got a headache after having a lunch at that place. I did ask them whether they use MSG, and they always say that they don't add any MSG, but do use sauces and ingredients with MSG. Funny logic! If they add ingredients and sauces that contain MSG, how can they claim they dont't use any MSG. Also, imitation crab in seafood dishes is pretty disgusting. Potrero Hill needs a good Asian restaurant. Elisa's, please come back!
Bottom line, no more lunches for me at Sunflower until they stop using MSG laden ingredients.
author: Prem M.

description:
I like it here.  I can certainly get cheaper, better tasting Viet food down in San Jose but that's like 50 miles away!  It's clean, the ambiance is great and cute (yes, cute).  Service is fairly well and the food is tasty.

Spring for the fish in claypot if you want something salty and somewhat spicy with lots of different herbs.  Claypot dishes usually hold the tastes in very well for the meats.  The beef with garlic dish is a good complement to the fish as it has more of lighter sauce with a medley of yummy veggies (red bell peppers, onions, green broccoli, cauliflower, zucchini).

The viet coffee isn't nearly as strong as some other ones, but it's worth a try if you haven't had any before.  Thai ice tea is nothing out of the ordinary.

All in all, great place.  Great service.  Portions are very good.  Better than that over rated Slanted Door joint.  :)
author: Yup S.

description: we had the worst service, TWICE. They will not seat you unless all your party is present, they don't care if you are parking, even though there were plenty of tables..The food is ok. We went to Chez Papa, where they greeted us, brought us free Fries while we were waiting outside. Never going back to Sunflower
author: Moe E.

description:
Are you serious?
I have been going to Sunflower on 16th/Valencia for well over a decade. On my last trip to the original, I noted the quality of seasoning had slipped but put it off to a bad night ... of course the ambiance of the original has always been sorely lacking but the food WAS great.  Last night I ate at the new location (after reading all of the 5 star reviews here) ... Warning-Do NOT Listen to them.

Yes, the decor is a HUGE improvement.
Yes, the service was as nice as always
NO ... the food was simply not good at all! It was flavorless and greasy.  

How can one mess up spring rolls?  Just go here to find out - we didn't even finish one order!  

The Pho was adequate but the seasoning was lacking.

The calamari salad: great dressing on good cabage/carrots but plain white chunks of steamed calamari - i.e. not marinated or seasoned AT ALL! 

And the "famous" Garlic Noodles were greasy with no finesse like in the old days ... just loaded with garlic.

Even the fried dishes were just heavy and had little flavor.  Come on ... this is Vietnamese cuisine which is arguably among the finest in the world - if this is authentic then someone out to tell the folks in Asia.  Sunflower was slipping before but now they have completely fallen - I hope they bring back whoever was actually doing the work before.
author: M P.

description: I usually get a vermicelli plate but I wanted to try something different yet still in my realm of comfort foods so I tried their pho (noodle soup) and success!  It was DELICIOUS.  Nice tender strips of beef, thin noodles, and all the accoutrements (lime, bean sprouts, hoison sauce, sriracha) that I'm used to.
author: Karen N.

description: Ate here last night. Crab & shrimp fried rice was amazing! As was hostess who sat us in the fabulous booth :-)
author: Joanna G.

description: Really good food! A large plate of delicious BBQ lemongrass beef for under $10 is a bargain. Pan fried and clay pot fish dishes are really tasty. Highly recommend.
author: Galina F.

description:
I live in Potrero and this is definitely one of my favorite joints.  I'm usually wary of Vietnamese restaurants that don't have the names of the dishes in Vietnamese or Vietnamese people working there but I was pleasantly surprised.   It's especially convenient since there's not really a lot of Vietnamese restaurants to choose from within a 3 mile radius.  

The vermicelli with pork and crispy eggrolls is usually a solid choice.  Their pho you should definitely avoid--not impressed.  Their shrimp spring rolls are also very good.  

The space is pretty small, service is pretty good.  Very casual, great spot for a quick meal.
author: yume n.

description:
I am a regular now to this place.  It was great to get some more Asian food up in Potrero Hill with the departure of Eliza (although pretty Americanized Chinese food).  The food is completely reasonably priced and the wait staff is great.
I tend to get the Five Spice Chicken with Imperial Rolls vermicelli which has a huge serving size.  I typically save half for lunch the next day.  Glad they have joined the P.Hill hood.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Didn't know what i was getting into when i went there --- but boy I enjoyed it!  

The staff were friendly and even funny joking with us.  We ordered veg potstickers which came out fresh and piping hot.  Did not even need the extra sauce. For main course we ordered the Garlic Chicken Noodles and Lemongrass Beef w/ green beans.  Both of these didn't last long!  Noodles were perfectly garlic and chicken tender (not dried out).  Beef very tasty in the sauce and green beans still a bit crispy. 

It was a bit warm inside due to it getting sun all afternoon but we sat in the window so wasn't all that bad.

Over all great for a date or fun with friends.  We spent $42 total, a price performer. Plus we left full and happy (the large beers also might of helped).
author: Terry C.

description:
I'm not even going to lie... I have gone back to this place maybe about 4 times since I was introduced to it. Which, was no more than 2 months ago. That says A LOT. 
My first dish ordered from here was the garlic noodles. WHOA!! They were to die for. If it wasn't because I wanted to try more dishes, I'd order this dish: EVERYTIME!! the noodles are cooked just right, they taste like noodles smothered in garlic, and not with a million other spices. They're very simple, but done so well. They're garnished with cilantro and cucumbers, which adds that freshness. But they're not crazy greasy and the chicken is tender, tastes like it was just made, and made specifically for this dish, and not just thrown over these noodles.   And they have this garlic hot sauce, it's spicy, but not too spicy, and addicting! 
The next dish I tried was the beef vermicelli bun bowl. I love it! It's light, tasty, the rolls are always cooked perfectly and the beef is tender, and seasoned to perfection. A nice dish ESP if you're trying to stay on the light side. Lol
The house fried rice! Ok, it has pineapple, and I love that. So I was sold. BUT, it was kind of bland. I'm not sure if it was just because I was expecting more, but it was alright. But I love that the meat in the dish is chopped up. I thought that was really cool, you don't have to stuff your mouth with a whole shrimp! Lol
PHO!!! PHO-king Uh---mazing!!! The broth is perfect, not too much noodles, thinly sliced meat, that does cook w/the heat of the broth. And omg, I can't wait for it to get colder so I can go more often!! Lol 
I've had my share of good PHO, and this broth makes this one one of my top 3, it's perfect, not too much anise, very savory but not over powering. 


I forgot to mention...
The portions are huge!!!
author: Lupe V.

description: This place is GREAT! The service is fast and friendly. The prices are decent and the Chicken Noodle Soup is DELICIOUS! Such a great neighborhood spot to go to on a rainy day.
author: Tamara A.

description: Great food and service, but the dishes are mostly made for sharing, so make sure you order with that in mind.
author: Eric S.

description:
The Pho was excellent.  I will come here to satisfy my next Pho craving, especially since its right in my neighborhood.  

The garlic noodles are awesome!

The rest of it is meh.  Spicy Seafood dish was not that spicy and overly sweet.  

The "shaken beef", usually a signature dish if served at a Vietnamese restaurant was nasty.  Not authentic.  SWEET!?  How could they??  

If they can't get it right they shouldn't call themselves authentic.
author: Spicy T.

description:
We had dinner here w/friends last night.  While the prices are very appealing, the quality is pretty erratic.  Started with steamed pot stickers.  They came with some sort of unknown sauce (seemed like a peanut sauce but didn't really taste like one) and they lived up to their name - they were super sticky, stuck to each other, stuck to the plate, the chopsticks...

We had chicken pho for the next course and this was A++.  As good as any I had in Vietnam.  Then on to curry beef w/jasmine rice.  I'm not sure what sort of curry it was (looked suspciously like the sauce that came with the sticky pot stickers) and the rice was dry: D+.  Our friends had shaken beef, which was tasty and something else I didn't try.

Overall, it wasn't an impressive experience despite the cheap prices.  I'll be back for the pho, though.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Came here a few weeks back with a friend of mine and have been wanting to go back ever since. The food was pretty grubbin, the place had a little dark feel to it however it just made it that much more romantic! the place is clean, has a nice ambiance and the customer service was pretty friendly. no issues on that part. 
My man is also a big fan as we split the Pho and the Garlic Noodles with Chicken. Needless to say i will be goiing back with whomever and i will DEF be ordering the Garlic noodles again. Thanks Sunflower for an awesome dinner!
author: Spookee X.

description: Rude interactions every time. I get that it is a cultural difference, but still. The food is just okay. I usually get a headache after eating there...MSG, I guess. I think I've had it with Sunflower...don't think I'll be going back.
author: Andrea N.

description: 3.5 stars really because of the value proposition.  You get heaping portions of well-prepared food here.  It's a really solid take on basic Asian fare, with strong, clean flavors.  The menu does a good job spanning from uber filling (garlic noodles) to light and flavorful (any of the vermicelli bowls).  Even the "lighter dishes" such as the vermicelli bowls come with enough deep fried imperial roles and meat to be filling.  The only dish I haven't liked is the vietnamese crepe.
author: Paul T.

description: Great spot!  Awesome garlic noodles.  Try the crispy noodles and Imperial Rolls.   Nice decor.  Crowded, but I think that's a great way for a restaurant to be!  Happy Tummy!
author: Camille H.

description: My friend wanted pho for her birthday so we ended up at Sunflower Potrero Hill. I've visited for lunch and thought it was good and super affordable but DINNER knocked my socks off! We ended up skipping pho and ordered the AMAZING SUNFLOWER PRAWNS, bbq pork, and 5 spice chicken, plus a couple orders of rice and it was perfection. Perfect flavor, perfect portion size, perfect, perfect, perfect. It is kind of small and it can get noisy but it's an adorable place with delicious food!
author: Valerie A.

description:
Sunflower is a great new addition to Potrero Hill for inexpensive but flavorful Asian food. I usually call ahead to order take-out and the food is ready within 15 minutes, the order is always correct, and the portions are generously sized. 

The garlic noodles are stellar, and I also highly recommend the lemongrass chicken (which comes with perfectly al dente string beans). They will also make most dishes extra spicy upon request.
author: Emily C.

description:
Great, if cramped, little spot...

The service can be a bit hit-or-miss when it gets busy, but I can see why they get busy to begin with...

A couple of dollars more then what you'd pay in the Tenderloin, but I guess that goes with the neighborhood...
author: Nathan W.

description: I love going there for lunch. Get there before noon because they're popular! Myfavorite is the Garlic Noodles with Tiger Prawns. For some reason it reminds me of the amazing Shrimp Trucks in Hawaii. So good.
author: M.E. T.

description:
I recommend this location of Sunflower.  I've been to the Sunflower restaurants in the Mission location several times before and they weren't quite as good.

The Pho ga was delicious.  This was the first time I have ever drank the entire pho soup.  Unfortunately, be warned, there may be a lot of MSG in the soup base as I immediately had a headache after my meal.  But, the meal was incredibly tasty.

The Garlic Noodles which everyone raved about on Yelp reviews were just okay in my opinion.  My bf on the other hand really enjoyed them. Overall the food is great.  I'd come back.
author: Tina K.

description: This is one of the best Vietnamese places in town.  I've been to the Mission location but the Potrero Hill location seems better.  Lunch is super cheap.  For $9, you can get a huge combination plate (I recommend the 5 spice chicken).  For $8, you can get a huge bowl of bun (vermicelli noodles with lemongrass pork and spring rolls).  The service was super.  Definitely a gem.
author: Toby C.

description: For the price you pay here, you get a lot of food! We didn't have to wait too long for lunch on a busy Saturday, the service was courteous and quick, but not in a I-must-hurry-you-along kind of way. I got the five spice chicken lunch special. The only part of the lunch special I could care less for is the salad.
author: Shang S.

description: 20 stars. This is BY FAR my favorite thai place to eat in SF. It is amazing. I have had nearly every item on the menu (we eat here at least 3 times a week) and there isn't anything that I don't like. My favorite items are the lemongrass beef bbq and the beef noodle soup. Fantastic!!! Oh and I almost forgot, they have the best thai iced tea around and FRESH coconuts that taste out of this world. The staff is also nice and happy to help out. Just can't say enough great things about this place!
author: K. N.

description:
We were definitely underwhelmed by this place. 

The good: 
- our group of 4 got seated pretty quickly after we arrived
- the food came out quickly
- not crazy expensive

The bad: 
- the food came out almost too quickly - made us wonder how much of it is made fresh. It didn't look or taste that fresh to me.
- the food just wasn't that good. I got the BBQ pork and the actual meat itself was kind of inedible. The rest of the dish was mediocre.
- even though it's not expensive, it wasn't worth it. Not worth my time, the calories, or the opportunity cost of going some place else. 
- found myself scrounging for other food not long after because I wasn't satisfied, physically or emotionally, by our meal
author: Amy L.

description:
in all honesty i had never ventured to this area before but with chez maman, chez papa and a few other restaurants, im sure we will be back!  

this vietnamese restaurant has more than just spring rolls, bun, and pho.  there are other dishes that are great as well.  we had the imperial spring rolls, pancake, fish in clay pot, garlic noodles with shrimp, and beef pho of course.  everything was good and we couldnt finish between the four of us so we had to take it home.  like thai food, vietnamese food is super pungent - the flavors are strong and bold. yum!

the wont seat you until most of the party is there.
author: claudia y.

description:
Sunflower is a great place to get your Pho fix in Potrero Hill. Me and my boyfriend stopped in here last Friday after a doctor's office visit in the area. He took me here because I was craving Pho and this is one of the few and only places he can find Bon Sao or Bon Mi in the city (I'm probably butchering these two names for a Vietnamese style crepe...sorry!). 

Anyway we stopped in here, and I immediately noticed the really nice ambiance of the restaurant. This made me question the authenticity of the food itself, since my favorite pho places I've found so far have been "hole in the wall" joints. I wouldn't say this place has fully authentic Vietnamese food by any means, but they make great and delicious food with quality portions and noticeable alterations to Vietnamese dishes that would appeal to the general area's population. Case in point, I love LOVE chicken pho. BUT, I hate the chicken pieces in other pho restaurants that still have the skin on them or include the tendons and whatnot in the soup. This place includes lean chicken breast pieces in their chicken pho...something I haven't had before but REALLY appreciated.  My boyfriend got a Vietnamese crepe (#8 on the dinner menu) that wasn't fully authentic but still really delicious according to him. We both left really full, very satisfied, and wanting to come back soon!
author: Dawn O.

description: YUMMY is all I have to say for this place. Not just great bang for your buck but the customer service is excellent. We have always had a great experience and great food when coming here. ENJOY
author: Maria L.

description:
Service= attentive and super fast service

Food= We had the garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken and spring rolls.... everything was awesome.  The spring rolls would have been enough because everything came in enormous portions.  We ended up taking a ton of food home.

Atmosphere= warm an cozy...tables are pretty close to eachother...kind of loud when it got packed...

Homo factor= not an issue

Price= average
author: Annmarie K.

description: Seriously people, this is the best, most reasonably priced Vietnamese food in the city. We always bring our visiting friends here because we are never disappointed. Shaken beef, sea bass, imperial rolls, noodle soups, fried rice, nothing fancy but all delicious, fresh and fast! Rarely a wait for a table, generally easy parking, and I love the bookstore down the block to peruse after dinner. No reason to go anywhere else for Vietnamese in the city.
author: Philip M.

description: The food is definiately not traditional Vietnamnese fare, but that is forgivable if they make good food, which they don't.
author: Liye Z.

description:
Just had dinner tonight at Sunflower in Potrero Hill. The food was great. Large portions. Must haves are the imperial rolls, garlic noodles, and string beans with chili, garlic and mushrooms. BBQ was OK but the chicken lemongrass was delicious. 

Glad we have a Vietnamese restaurant in Potrero Hill.
author: Michael C.

description: My favorite restaurant! The pork is the best I have ever had anywhere. The pho, imperial roles, and hot and sour soup are all amazing. The only things I have had here that aren't good (I've had almost the entire menu over the years) is the thai iced tea and curry plate.
author: SF R.

description:
i was SO SO looking forward to trying this place because there are NO Vietnamese restaurants near where I work... and finally this one popped up not too long ago. The Imperial Rolls are nothing like the fried egg rolls I experienced at any other authentic Vietnamese restaurants... and I went to school in Westminster, CA (aka Little Saigon) plus the majority of my friends back then was Vietnamese. Their parents never made rolls like these! It was tasty, but because I expected something different, I was very disappointed.

I would give it another try since this review is only based in the Imperial Rolls..
author: Marian C.

description:
HUGE portions. garlic noodles (duh)--so good. only 4 shrimp though? c'mon.
on a nice day i like to call my order in (gets super busy during lunch) and eat it at the park a couple blocks away.
for a $10 (delicious) meal that can feed a family of 4, i'd give this place 5 stars anyday
author: Lia A.

description: My first time at Sunflower.  I got lunch to go.  It seemed a little expensive, but I got 2 HUGE tubs of chicken fried rice and tiger prawns with garlic noodles, enough food for 4 people !  And, I can't describe how delicious it was.  I will definitely make it one of my regular places for fabulous Vietnamese food !
author: Eddie W.

description:
All the dishes I've tried here, and there have been quite a few, are great. It's one of my favorite places to eat and my children enjoy it very much as well. 
I highly recommend Sunflower whether you eat in or take out.
author: Joyce S.

description: Eating here at least once a week is a must for me. They have great food and friendly service. I am constantly finding new favorites on the menu like the pho and the garlic noodles. Love it!
author: Julie O.

description: This is a neighborhood restaurant full with local pot hill folks.  This place is always busy for dinner but service is fast and great.   I have dined in and ordered out a few times but I have a tendency to get similar things each time.   I like their pho, garlic noodle, thai iced tea, and vermicelli dishes.  I heard from others that the lemongrass chicken is good as well.   Their prices are very reasonable.   Parking is never a problem and the view is awesome from the street.     I will be going to this place for a long time.   I am only giving 4 stars because i have only tried a few dishes there.
author: Kelly M.

description: Sunflower is our go to eat place in our neighborhood (Potrero Hill). Would highly recommend. Pad thai and pho here are pretty good. My favorite dish is actually the House Fried Rice (with pineapple and combination of other good stuff). Can get packed at times, but well worth the wait. Will come back. =)
author: Jason L.

description: Yum!!!! Love the garlic noodles and the crispy noodles with tofu and vegetables. So good. Love this place because I'm a vegetarian. Every time I come here the food is delicious. Thai iced tea is also amazing.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Over the past 20 years, I have seen restaurants come and go from this location among the other restaurants on 18th Street.  This is the only one that has made it work, and with good reason.

It is not overly fancy, and is very reasonably priced.  There is a good selection of choices on the menu -- all of which are tasty.  And most importantly, the owner and wait staff are some of the friendliest, kindest people that I have ever met.

My favorite dish is the Sunflower Crepe.  But caution: it is messy to eat.  Don't order it on your first date.

They have a nice dining room if you care to eat out, and it is also a great place to order carry out.

Be sure to put it on your list of restaurants to try.
author: Conrad S.

description: I have a few pet peeves.  One major one is watered down cuisine when the restaurant indicates it is authentic.  I love Vietnamese food and was looking forward to having a tasty affordable restaurant in my work hood.  Sunflower is nice but doesn't give SF diners the cred they deserve like serving tendon, beef balls, brisket, etc. in their Pho.  It is nice that everything is fresh but I think they are cheating Potreroians out of an authentic Vietnamese meal.
author: Monica L.

description: I don't understand how this place could get 4 stars. Okay, the food was good in comparison with other Vietnamese restaurants. BUT, the waitress (who was an older lady) was EXTREMELY rude and unfriendly. It doesn't matter how good the food was, the poor customer service left a bad aftertaste for me.
author: Lia T.

description:
This place has great lunch specials, which is all I can comment on, as I only ever go for lunch. But for $8.50 you get soup, spring rolls, rice (even brown rice if you want!!), salad, and a main course like stir-fry or something- to me this is absolutely excellent value, and it's all fresh and super tasty too.

In fact everything on the lunch menu is pretty fresh and tasty looking, but I usually get the special with green bean stir fry.

I probably wouldn't come here for dinner because the menu isn't exciting enough for a night-time visit, in my opinion.
author: Carlin S.

description:
Had dinner here for the first time last week. I'm excited to have a good noodle place in my neighbourhood.

The restaurant is quiet; we were seated and served very quickly, and the staff were attentive (our water glasses were never empty).

I had the garlic noodles, which were delicious; my friend's curry and brown rice dish was also quite good.
author: Paul S.

description: The food here is very fresh and true to the reviews. I tried the shaken beef and garlic noodles that everyone raved about and really enjoyed both. The noodles were a little on the sticky side... but the next day they tasted even better. The beef had a wonderfully complex flavor and was very tender. The atmosphere is great and service good. I also got the imperial rolls which were slightly too greasy but flavorful. I would definitely go back and experience more.
author: M K.

description: Really good deals on lunch specials. And the clay pot fish is great.
author: James B.

description:
may not be the most authentic vietnamese restaurant but it's freakin tasty.

we went there with some friends and we hoped that their no reservation policy wouldn't bite us.  fortunately, it didn't.

we were seated right away and were immediately taken aback by how affordable the menu was.  also, we were unaware of how big the portion sizes were.

for appetizers we got the fried veggie pot stickers and the vietnamese crepe.  had we knows the size of the crepe we would've stuck to that.  the pot stickers were good but we have had better elsewhere.  they were almost too fried.  the crepe however was well made and tasty as heck.

for entrees, one of our friends and i got the bbq pork and imperial roll vermicelli bowl.  my wife and one of our friends split the lemongrass chicken along w/ the veggie fried rice.  the vermicelli bowl was very VERY good and rivaled the one i've been having at Sai's in the FiDi for years.  the chicken and rice i heard were very good too.  honestly, we could've had 50% of the dishes here and walk out full.  we just couldn't finish everything.

we were pretty happy with the overall price too.  nothing can be said wrong for a place that can dish out good food and at prices that are darn right good.
author: Swarup B.

description:
I was so overjoyed to find that Sunflower had a second location.  Potrero Hill is much less congested and has better parking than the Mission, plus the atmosphere is much more elegant and relaxed.  Not to knock the Mission location (I LOVE Sunflower, period), but this place wins between the two for me.

I literally crave this food.  It is the best lunch deal in the city.  For $8.50 (that includes Saturdays!) you get amazing Vietnamee hot and sour soup, an imperial roll (order the vegetarian one -- it's bigger and better) and entree (go for the lemongrass anything) rice (brown all the way -- it's really more purple-ish and stick and yummy) and cabbage salad.

The service is solid -- not overly friendly, not rude.  Again, the decor is lovely (think there was a Moroccan restaurant there before Sunflower) -- lots of purples and reds.  But all of this is just a side note.  The food is the main focus here as it should be.

I can't stand it.   I want to go NOW!
author: Aurora B.

description:
tasty, fresh, clean, great service, big portions.

our waiter was super friendly, not in the annoying kind of way.  we had the lemongrass chicken, and the chicken vermicelli.  the lemongrass chicken was a heaping pile of delicious chicken and green beans, with some spices. the green beans were amazing!

just finished off the leftovers... ahhh....
author: eric f.

description:
Great little place and packed last night. Was in search of some asian food after some wine tasting @SOM. The ambience was good and we got the last open table for two. We ordered three dishes: curry prawns, garlic noodles with beef and lemongrass chicken. And had leftovers for tmrw.

The portions were very generous, and the service was very fast.. I would say lemongrass chicken was my favorite since it had all those flavors of onion, garlic, ginger and red pepper to boot.  Garlic noodles were good, but not as buttery as other incarnations(would get them again though).

The curry prawns as nichole states were okay. I enjoyed the panoply of colors for the veggies, but maybe it wasn't spicy enough or creamy. Prawns were delicious themselves though. Funny how it is difficult to please everyone though as some thought it was too spicy...
author: Peter F.

description: One of my favorite restaurants to eat at for lunch and a great place for dinner.  Several of my coworkers agree that this place has great food, great service, and overall a great atmosphere.  Highly recommend their lunch specials - especially the 5 spice chicken.
author: M T.

description:
It's my second time here and I'm doubly satisfied. I find the food to be one of the most authentic Vietnamese restaurant in SF. The service is great, has a relaxed atmosphere in a quiet part of town and with ample parking. 

I'll be back for sure!!
author: Tony S.

description:
We may have eaten on a bad night, or just ordered the wrong food.  Folks on this board like the spring rolls and fresh rolls and they did look good.

But - the Crab and Asparagus soup was tasteless and featured minimal crab and overcooked white asparagus - more like an egg drop soup.  We couldn't save it, even with tons of hot sauce. 

The shaken beef was OK and plentiful, but was served without any vegetables.  The vegetarian noodle pot was very good, and diners around us seemed to enjoy what they were eating.

Service was indifferent at best - many of us on the floor had to wave for service and the check multiple times.
author: Tod E.

description: Cheap, fast, not as delicious as the sunflowe in the mission.  Too bad.
author: Brianna C.

description: A rare non-divey Vietnamese restaurants that caters to the residents on Potrero Hill.  Good execution.  The price is 20% higher than your divey version, but they give you giant prawns and better ingredients.  Not bad.
author: Laurence H.

description: Nice, classic Vietnamese spot on Potrero Hill, an area with a great view of downtown SF. The menu is traditional with time-honored classics, but also a quiet, warm, delightful neighborhood spot with efficient service - nice for couples on a weekday. It has some of the best Bun Thit Nuong in the city (marinated pork vermicelli noodles mixed wit a spring roll), gently splash a little spicy nuoc mam (fish sauce) over the noodles for a light, enticing, elegant array of southern Vietnamese flavor.
author: Robert B.

description: Sunflower restaurant is delicious. We went out for dinner on sunday night with a party of nine, and eventhough it was packed full and we were a big group, they found space for all of us. The food was on point. They came quick with our orders. Ill be going back for sure. P.S I love the red and design inside.
author: Bessy M.

description: Went here for my boyfriend's birthday after the wait was too long up the street.  Wow, what a surprise!  So delicious, service was great and the food was so good.  Recommend this place.
author: T. H.

description:
I come here for lunch at least once a week with my coworkers.

The food is good and fresh. The service is always good and the lady who own/runs the restaurant loves to joke around with my co worker.

The lunch special is big portioned and you always leave feeling full.
author: Brian W.

description:
Location = Love this area of Potrero where you can find several neighborhood eateries. Parking is TOUGH though.
Decor = Warm interiors, small dining area where you can say hi to your neighbors.
Staff = Friendly and the service is fast.
Food = It's one of our go-to spots in SF. The food never disappoints and EVERYTHING is good. Love their Sunflower Prawns w/garlic noodles.
author: Vibby V.

description:
I wrote this place off the first time I went- Garlic Noodles waaaay to garlicky. My mistake? Maybe, but why would you offer noodles on your menu with no vegetables or anything on it? You have to ask and pay extra for the vegetables apparently.  This is not common in a Vietnamese restaurant. Usually dishes on the menu are balanced and well-considered.  Also, I'm sick of SF restaurants charging so much for so little. I know SF restaurant goers feel like this place is reasonable. It can be, but when you know you can get the same quantity at better quality for $3-5 less in other cities, it starts to really get under your skin.

Next visit was out of desperation. I was really sick and could barely walk to get the pick up, but had to eat and everyone knows Pho is good for the sick....I walk up a little delirious and wait at the closer end of the bar/counter. The owner notices my condition and even makes a comment.  It was a bit rude, but the worst part was when I tell her I'm paying by card. I make a gesture to hand her my card and she says, "give it to me here." As in, she made me walk it to her even though I look like I need to go to the emergency room. By the way, she wasn't in the middle of anything.  BTW- the Pho ga was just okay. How disappointing.

Believe it or not, this review is actually about my third and latest attempt at Sunflower. I live nearby so it is inevitable that this restaurant sneak back into the rounds. I also wanted to get something that I was impressed with, considering how many people like this place (service aside).  In an attempt to give the place a try (my boyfriend thinks the place is fine), I read the reviews and find one to be quite helpful. Karen N. suggests the vermicelli which is apparently hard to screw up in vietnamese restaurants. Great! I order this with the bbq pork and it comes with imperial roll. I have to say, I think I found my go to dish.  I know I spent a lot of time slamming this place, but I'm happy I found something!  So even though they don't offer the thai tea with coconut milk which is the traditional way to make it, and a nice non-dairy option, I am pleased with my meal even if a bit annoyed.  Lunch price is reasonable- $7.50 for good portion! All in $8.21.  I'm happy about this value in particular.

Unfortunately, Sunflower found a way to screw it up. Guy hands me itemized bill- $8.21. I hand him my card. When I get the credit card bill back it says $9.31.  He entered in a greater amount on the CC machine!  Long story short, DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE.  If you do, make sure you look at your receipt. They just want to take your money. That may be the case in most places, but at least act like you care about serving good food and you care about return customers. That is all.
author: Faith R.

description: I'm just writing this to comment on the review I just read. What kind of genius orders GARLIC noodles and complains about them having too much GARLIC???? Some people shouldn't be allowed to write on here.
author: Brad C.

description: I love sunflower!  So happy they moved into the space on Connecticut!  Leslie is awesome and always remembers her customers and the food is good too!  Lots of gluten free options as well!
author: R L.

description: My favorite go to Vietnamese restaurants now.  Love how clean and modern looking this place is.  One of the best garlic noodles I have ever had.  The noodles are stir fried perfectly with lots of garlic.  The bbq pork with imperial roll rice plate or vermicelli is so flavorful.  The food here is reasonably priced and you get the ambiance and less greasiness, this place is so worth it.  Portion sizes are pretty generous and we always leave full.
author: Yun W.

description: Been here for lunch several times, fresh, tasty, a great value, and people know it, the place is always packed.  Sunflower got the power
author: Jason D.

description: The odds of me being attacked by a vampire are significantly reduced.  The most delicious garlic noodles.  Ever.  Not greasy or oily like at some places.  Good chunks of some sort of savory garlic concoction on top of the noodles.  Huge portion sizes too at incredibly reasonable prices (average $10).  Other dishes are good too, but the garlic noodles are a must order.
author: Tara C.

description: Best Pho Ive ever had! Not too salty, white meat chicken and crunchy veggies. YUM! Ill be back here weekly!
author: Heather G.

description: My very favorite thing, hands down, the imperial rolls!  They were delicious, flavorful with the right mix of ingredients.  The spring rolls were a bit of a disappointment as there were tons of noodles and not so many shrimp. :(  The Slanted Door Out the Door ones are much better...  However, the shaken beef was really yummy.  Overall a real find!
author: Kara H.

description: The pho is excellent! It's probably not authentic, but the broth smells very clean, and the beef was tender and flavorful. I added vegetables and was surprised at how fresh they were. The portion is also huge for the price. The Thai tea is a bit weaker than I prefer, but everything else was great. I would definitely come back.
author: Polly C.

description:
This is my favorite Vietnamese spot in town.
The lunch specials are cheap and delicious. My favorite is the BBQ pork with Imperial rolls over Vermicelli. Get there around 11:50 for lunch to avoid a long wait.
author: F C.

description:
I recently moved from Seattle to SF. Miss my mom's authentic Hue inspired dishes. We heard about Sunflower from a friend and tried it on a Thursday night.

This was a hot spot on a Thursday, we had to wait outside for 7 minutes+ to get a seat for two because the place was full. Our host and waiter was nice, we ordered and got our food quickly. 

FOOD ORDERED: 
BBQ lemongrass beef with imperial rolls
Seafood pan fried noodles

Meat was well seasoned. A lot of meat and vegetable was provided for both noodle dishes. My only critique: meat was boiled and then placed on grill to cook. It would have tasted better if it was grilled only, just like how the street vendors cook it in Vietnam.
author: Tam N.

description: Fresh spring rolls - yum! Also tried the Chicken Noodle soup (pho) and the House Fried Rice. Spring rolls were by far the best, but the soup was pretty good (probably would have been better if I'd eaten it there), not overly salty. Had vermicelli noodles, chicken, bean sprouts, and jalapenos, I didnt actually eat the jalapenos, but I did add some siracha to pump up the spice level. The fried rice, well, how can you go wrong with fried rice?? It had pineapple chunks and chicken and shrimp... pretty good. I would go back for the spring rolls! And I'd order the soup again when I'm sick or in the winter :)
author: Aryn Y.

description: This is my favorite restaurant of the moment.  Yet to have a bad dish.  The crepe is always crispy and hot on the outside but cool and succulent on the inside.  The shaken beef is tops, the bbq pork is my wife's favorite, the garlic noodles hit the spot perfectly.  Plus they offer brown rice.  And they have Stone IPA in bottles.  I've only eaten at the Potrero location and I will be back many times over.  So much on the menu for me to discover.
author: E L.

description: Been back numerous times since my first time and Sunflower has yet to disappoint.  In fact, it has become a mainstay in our takeout rotation.  Most recently, as hard as it was to pull myself away from some form of the garlic noodles, I got the 5 spices roasted chicken and it blew me away.  I've gotten it the past two times and along with their great brown rice might be my favorite meal on earth at the moment.  So, sooooo good.
author: Sean H.

description: I love this place!  Seeing that I live a couple blocks down the street, this has become my go to place for dinner.  It is nice to be a local somewhere that the staff knows who you are and they always are so friendly when I visit.  My favorite two dishes on the menu are the BBQ Lemongrass Beef and the Garlic Noodles.  I swear, their food is addictive.
author: Curt Y.

description: Been here a few times now and love everything especially the prices! Great beef salad which is large and very fresh for lunch. Spring rolls of all kinds are delicious for appetizers - it's easy to go nuts over-ordering for sure. Be prepared for a short wait at lunch this is a hugely popular spot. Really nice staff.
author: Mariangela S.

description: Probably the best beef/vegetarian pho I've ever had. Lots of veggies and flavorful, savory broth that you just know is good for you. I give it a four star rating because they charged a dollar extra for extra green onions and cilantro when it hardly had any in the first place! Well, they also forgot about my order of imperial rolls, but, in the end, it didn't actually matter after all because the pho truly did satiate my gustatory desires and maybe if I did get the imperial rolls, I wouldn't have enjoyed my soup as much to be writing this review right now!
author: Myra Y.

description: Awesome.  Every dish is good.  The Imperial Rolls are the best I have had in the city.  Shaken Beef is delicious.  Garlic Noodles are fantastic.  I cant wait to go back and try more dishes.  Fantastic food.
author: Harry E.

description: Despite some negative reviews here, I find this to be an outstanding place. Yes, big portions and the Pho is tastely, delicate, and made from top quality ingredients. Steamed vegetarian dumplings, shrimp sautee, and everything on other people's plates looked great. While you are here, stroll around to other one of a kind places. Unparalleled views of SF at night.
author: Fred  D.

description: I'll be back. Great service, great food. I wish I'd have tried the pho... the spicy green beans were spectacular. The imperial egg rolls were very good. The calamari, good, but not what I thought I had ordered. Prices were very reasonable.
author: Harry M.

description: Sunflower prawns w/ garlic noodles, WASSUP, HELLA GOOD.
author: Hana G.

description: Same excellent food as the one in the mission.  For lunch, I usually get one of the lunch specials, either the bbq pork or chicken, and a fresh coconut.  Parking is actually easier around here than the other location, so that's another plus.   I've actually been going here more often now because it's closer to my place than the mission's and it's safer.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I've never had a bad meal here - dine in or take out. In fact, it's our go to place when we have out of towners who are in the mood for a night off from the SF food scene. 

You can't go wrong with the chicken noodle soup (it cures everything... really) which is essentially pho, the garlic noodles, the grilled beef and the lemongrass chicken. 

We fight over the leftovers.
author: AceGirl ..

description: Came for lunch with the wife. Had a lunch special for 8.50 and got a salad, soup, spring roll with rice and lemon grass chicken. Tons of food and it was all delicious. The wife had Pho and said it was great. We will be back!
author: Kevin M.

description: I went here on my lunch break and they are fast and tasty... Yellow curry, garlic chicken and fresh spring rolls were great. Really what more can you ask for?
author: Lauren B.

description: I was pleased to see that Baraka shut down and Sunflower moved in. It rounds out the options at the 18th and Conn intersection in terms of cuisine and cost. You can go cheap with pho or vermicelli or splurge on one of the rice dishes. I had the vermicelli with 5-spice chicken for under $10. Full of flavor and large in portion size. Quick, easy, consistent. What more could you ask for? Plus, this Sunflower is brand new with swankier decor than the Mission location. And less crowded!
author: Susan L.

description: I love Vietnamese cuisine and there was so my hype around Sunflower and I had to give it a try.  Our table had a pho, clay pot special, garlic shrimp noodles, spring rolls, and the lunch special.  Everything tasted authentic but it was okay.  Nothing really screamed "COMEBACK!"  Definitely worth it if you live or are happen to be in the neighborhood and want something quick, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: LIVE to E.

description:
Good food, inexpensive, fresh and yummy.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots on the Hill.  I work in the neighborhood and eat veggie primarily, so Sunflower is frequently on my lunch list.  I love the veggie vermicelli and the lunch specials, which are huge and offer great variety.  The owner always remembers me and my coworkers and has both our usual orders and water preferences down.  The food is really tasty and fresh, and unless I'm ravenous that day, the portions always leave me enough for later.
author: Andie Z.

description:
Wonder what it is about this space in Potrero Hill that wears so many hats (high turnover rate) I've seen it's past lives as the "The little Dipper" and "Baraka" probably a few more lives I've seen but just have forgotten about. 

The latest installment "Sunflower" I was told just moved in 2 weeks ago. Still dressed like a Middle eastern coffeehouse, the Sunflower currently reigns in the high turnover corner of 18th and Connecticut. The sister restaurant is in the Mission, the Potrero location is minus the hustle and bustle of the trendy skinny jeans mecca and minus the waiting list (for now at least). I'm hoping this is a match made in heaven as far as the tenacny of this establishment. Vietnamese cuisine in my book is simply excellent! The hybrid of French influences married with Asian flavor and fresh tasting ingredients, now in the atmosphere of Potrero Hill at reasonable dinning prices. My only objection is that the menus were a little dumbed down, I had to ask if the soups on the menu mentioned were Pho? (why change that?) But kudos to this establishment for stepping up their game, all I have to say is, excellent food and service, love it!
author: B H.

description:
I love pho. I love this restaurant. The beef in the pho is perfectly cooked and lean. The broth has meaty flavor but doesn't give you the msg coma afterwards. I'd also recommend the vermicelli bowl- the eggrolls are amazing, and the brown rice with lemongrass chicken. The spicy  lemongrass chicken was amazing. It wasn't too spicy, but the flavor was excellent . The vegetable curry is good- the curry flavor is good, but I would recommend getting it with meat if you're not a vegetarian. Sunflower's brown rice is amazing. I have no idea how they make it. I tried asking our server but it's apparently a secret, which makes sense because if I knew how they made it, I'd probably make it myself every single day.  The fresh spring rolls are a great appetizer. They are made with fresh ingredients, not like the ones you find with browning lettuce and questionable pork inside at other places. They are quality.

Service is great, the lady in charge (you'll know who she is when you enter the restaurant) is really nice and funny. The atmosphere is warm and perfect for dates, groups or just a quick bite. The place is small, and sometimes there is a line waiting outside, but it's well worth the wait.
author: Tyler C.

description: Great lunch catering. People there were friendly and gave good suggestion on the menu.
author: V L.

description: The food is good and the prices are very reasonable. I frequent Sunflower for lunch and their daily lunch specials always taste great and fill me up. The owner or manager (not sure which she is) is funny, friendly and always very helpful.
author: Michael L.

description: Get take out here at least 1-2x/month, and while it has not been my favorite, it's easy and close to my house. When craving some Vietnamese, I go there but always reluctantly. It's cheap and the staff is nice. But the food quality is just horrible. And my recent experience just confirms it. I just had a meat dish and the meat literally tasted like soft (not in a good way, more like in a weird uncooked way - i had to reheat it in the oven to fully cook it) weird soft paper. The vegetables were also subpar, or old-tasting. It was unpleasant and I composted most of it. Spring rolls are good; other than that, I hope they improve the food quality because it is a great staple to have good Vietnamese in the neighborhood. I hope the management can improve the food quality so I can start eating there again.
author: Monica S.

description:
tofu lunch special.
lot of food for the price.
author: Henry H.

description: This is our favorite local restaurant! The vermicelli, BBQ beef with imperial rolls is amazing. I've had it plenty times at other Vietnamese restaurants, but Sunflower makes it the best!
author: Megan N.

description: The Pho was good. Spring rolls (shrimp) were OK, nothing to write home about. Try the pho with the meat on the side. Fast service.
author: Tuhin S.

description: Quick and good food that won't break your wallet. Popular place on the hill... always busy. That says something. Be courteous and don't block the walk ways and try the claypot dishes! they're my fave!
author: gary a.

description: Food is mediocre. Definitely had better Vietnamese food in other Vietnamese restaurants. Garlic noodle tasted pretty much like noodle with a slight hint of garlic. Nothing to rave about. Clay pot rice is so-so. There wasn't much flavor to the rice at all. Curry beef was pretty good on the other hand. Beef was tender and there was a lot of curry sauce and vegetables that came with it.
author: Kenneth T.

description:
A few stars for friendly, efficient staff and an abundance of food at a fair price ...

But no stars for food safety.  I got very sick within a few hours after eating a late lunch there (vegetarian spring roll & vegetarian soup).  I had malaise, chills & sweating, and then spent the night praising the porcelain alternating with major diarrhea.  A day later, I'm still flattened, have no energy, and don't want to eat any food.   Suffice it to say that once I'm fully recovered and want to eat food again, I don't intend to eat their food again.  It makes me sad because they're very friendly and professional, but I just don't trust their food and don't care to chance a repeat experience.
author: k. v.

description: Really great atmosphere and friendly staff. The portions are large and flavorful! I got the garlic noodles with tofu and it was super yummy. Could only eat half. My friend got the curry chicken and thought it was so killer that I should forgo my vegetarian diet to try it (I did not :) Will definitely return and maybe up my stars after the next time. Can't be perfect just after 1 visit people!
author: Unicorn U.

description: I love, love, love this place! I live in Potrero Hill, so I find myself eating here a couple of times a month. I'm obsessed with their imperial rolls (you get 8 pieces!!) and chicken pho. I've never waited more than 10 minutes for a table, and the service is guaranteed to be quick. I plan to keep coming back here again and again.
author: William d.

description: I got takeout, Lunch Special #1 and it was pretty good.  The chicken (although the piece was unidentifiable -Breast? Thigh?  No clue!) had really good flavor but a crazy layer of fat on top that I had to peel off.  The spring roll was AMAZING!  The soup kinda freaked me out.  The sauces were great, too.  Next time I'll order the garlic noodles, I hear they're good.
author: Rachelle P.

description: delicious, lots of food. could probably order a dish for every 2 people, especially if you get the noodle-based dishes. get the meat on the side for the pho.
author: Sahil L.

description:
Delicious fresh and healthy food, and great selection. The pho is excellent.

They need outdoor seating, though!!!!! Several times we have been there on warm evenings and decided to go to the Mexican place across the street just because they had outdoor seating and Sunflower didn't.
author: Geae D.

description: Great garlic noodles. more than one person can eat. service is nice. phone ordering is rough. Speak very fast and you have to be brief to the point. Like you would do in China or any other Asian country. no hellos, no thank you...well the kind when people really mean it!
author: Leon L.

description: The garlic eggplant was AMAZINGLY delicious and tender.  The brown rice and their thai iced tea were good.  Half star off because they didn't serve any dessert and well, just because.
author: Chris W.

description: We were looking for a place to have dinner on Friday night and decided to try Sunflower.  The food was really outstanding.  I ordered Lemongrass Chicken, which comes with green beans and onions.  It was perfect!  Spicy and very flavorful, but not oily.  I could eat this dish every week.   We ordered a side of garlic noodles for the table and they were top notch!  My husband had shaken beef, which he was very happy with also.  The portions are big, so I had some left over for lunch! The sunflower crepe we ordered as an appetizer was not anything special and I would definitely try something different next time.  Overall service was decent, but we had a hard time getting a hold of the hostess.  The food was so good, I know we will be back here in a couple of months.
author: Lidiya B.

description: I went here one time with friends and was pleasantly surprised by the food. The shaking beef was delicious and was good for the price. I went back a second time to get the shaking beef and try some other stuff but the service turned me away. In fact, I walked out because no one acknowledged me for 5 minutes and when finally noticed they pointed at some menus. They didn't provide how long it would take to be seated and ignored me after multiple times of trying to get the servers attention granted they were busy. You are never to busy for customers. I don't think I'll ever be going back again! I'm giving this place 2 stars because their food was decent.
author: Vanessa C.

description: I am so excited this place is finally open!  I've been to the mission location a bunch of times, but it was a PITA to do takeout.  We called the other night, sans menu, and were able to place an order.  Here's hoping this place does as well as the other 18th street restaurants!
author: Shannon H.

description: Excellent chicken salad -  great curries, noodles and soup.  Fast and cheap!  Great for take out and the woman on the phone is hilarious.
author: Mel H.

description: I must confess that I eat here at least once a week, sometimes even more often.  The Vermicelli is my favorite, and I cycle through the pork, chicken, and beef (pork is the best!).  Their Pho is surprisingly good for a non-noodle house.  I don't dine in too often so I can't comment too much on service, but the people I interact with for my to-go orders are very nice.
author: Yosuke Y.

description:
I had the pan fried noodles-combination.  My friends had the vermicelli.  Both were awesome.  The fried rolls appetizer was good too.  
They had the coconut, which looked really good too.  When you're done drinking the coconut, they cut it open and you can eat the coconut.  
Nice atmosphere.  Would be a nice date place.
They don't like using a credit card for under $22, which is difficult when going to lunch w/ co-workers and need to put on seperate tabs.
author: Jason L.

description: Yummy Lemon Grass Tofu! I've been to this Sunflower a couple of times and both times I ordered a vegetarian dish. But, the great thing is that I did not miss meat because their tofu is tasty. I had the tofu salad my first trip because I was not very hungry after a large breakfast but I tried a bite of my friend's lemon grass tofu and I knew I would get that my next trip. My second time there I ordered the lunch special which came with lemon grass tofu and green beans, brown rice, imperial roll, hot and sour soup, and salad. The tofu is tasty, the portions are huge, and you leave feeling very full and satisfied : )
author: Lisa M.

description:
Proving that even good restaurants can have off nights (if my fellow Yelpers are to be believed).

Four stars for the ambience and service minus 2 stars for the food and I feel I'm being generous.

We tried this place for the first time tonight. It was full, a good sign!

Food wise -
I wasn't very hungry so I ordered the fresh shrimp rolls. Vermicilli, lettuce, shrimp on top & wrapped in a rice paper wrap that felt as if it had been left out for a while as the ends were dry. No herbs in there, nothing to lift the blandness. It came with a nice sate sauce but wasn't overall a fan of this dish.

Husband ordered pot stickers to start. They turned up looking more like circular croquettes deepfried with what we took to be a crunchy rice outer. Ok but not that good he said.

He followed with chicken noodle soup with extra veggies. He's eaten a lot of noodle soups in his time and pronounced this the worst ever :-( I tasted it and the stock tasted like that commercial powdered stuff you add water to. The chicken was nice breast strips but given the blandness of the stock were also bland. The added veggies were plentiful however they were a mix of western ones (cauliflower, squash, courgette as well as pea pods and broccoli). It did come with beansprouts, asian basil, a (I assume) Tamarind type sauce and chili to season however husband is currently off chilli so had to resort to asking for soy sauce to give it some flavor. 

I get that not everyone wants "authentic" Vietnamese however if this is pleasing the western palate I'll pass thanks.
author: D M.

description: I love this place.  I dream about the grilled pork bun and everything else is great too. The space is also pretty and clean which is somewhat unusual for a tasty Vietnamese place.
author: Julia W.

description: Gosh the food was just plain old boring and bad. Hardly felt any flavor in any of the 4 dishes we ordered. The soup was very blah, the Vietnamese crepe was filled with bean sprouts, the Eggplant was so strong on garlic and onions and the Vegetable curry was something you can get at a cheaper food stand. I dont understand the rave about this place. Its definitely not a place I would go ever again.
author: lajja s.

description: The Sunflower Prawns are to die for.  I'm not typically a fan of asian seafood, but this dish takes the cake. Four jumbo prawns resting over a pile of garlic noodles with some sort of yummy sticky brown sauce over them. Heaven on earth.
author: Val U.

description: I came here regularly for take-outs. But I will no longer bring my business here. My husband and I were meeting 2 other friends there for an early dinner tonight. Our friends showed up at 6:30pm. The restaurant wasn't busy, there were perhaps 4-6 other customers. Many tables were available. The waitress refused to seat our friends because my husband and I weren't there yet. They called us and we were a few blocks away. Didn't make any difference. I'd understand if it was busy and there weren't many tables open. This happened before, except we were waiting for a friend to show up. That time, my husband and I were shoved aside to the bar while waiting for one more friend to join us, and we were ignored for the most part while waiting. We tolerated that time because they were very busy. And I thought since I'm kind of a regular, they would make an exception. No such luck for this regular. So enough is enough. I can put up with mediocre food, but poor customer service is unacceptable. I told the waitress they lost our business for good because this is not how customers want to be treated. She gave me a blank stare and didn't seem to care. I will bring my business and my friends somewhere else when looking for a restaurant in Potrero Hill, like we did tonight. This is not the only game in town.
author: Cecilia L.

description: Good neighborhood spot.  Soups and noodles are done well. The vegetarian spring rolls have a great sauce.
author: Clayton K.

description:
My favorite was the garlic noodles and the imperial rolls.
Parking was easy and the wait staff friendly.
Iced coffee was strong and sweet.
Give it a try, a great alternative to the typical vietnamese restaurant. Nice decor, feels modern and fun. Great place to enjoy good food and drinks with good friends.
author: C L.

description: This place is awesome! There is enough seating on the inside for maybe 25 people. I love tofu, so I usually get a dish with that. It's fast, delicious, and plentiful! You will not walk away hungry. They have lunch specials too!! The owners are totally cute and very personable.  Love family owned small businesses!! You gotta check this place out.  I've been here at least 4-5 times and have never been disappointed.
author: Anisha W.

description: I like the food at the Sunflower on 16th but it always makes my clothes smell greasy/smoky, so that is a downside. This place, in the old Baraka, decor the same, also has good food but with better ventilitation. The lunch special is an imperial role, cabbage salad, soup, and another dish for $8.50, which seems reasonable to me because you get a ton of good food. There are 2 vegetarian lunch special options.
author: Amy E.

description: The vermicelli noodles with imperial rolls and barbeque beef was delicious. Great food and a nice ambiance for the price. If you're around during the day, check out their lunch specials.
author: m t.

description: We've ate here a couple times. We've only experienced mediocre food, and one of us is Vietnamese, born native. The last time we tried to dine here we walked in and only one table in the entire place was occupied. We were given curt instructions that we would only be seated if the entire party was there, despite my pointing out (through window) our car was looking for parking. We had to stand awkwardly for the few minutes until our friend was done parking. As a customer, you cater to me, not the other way around. We left after we could not stand to look at the menu any longer, and were warmly welcomed and promptly seated at the always busy aperto across the street. This place doesn't deserve my hard-earned money.
author: Judy J.

description: I must admit it felt a little strange eating Vietnamese food in a room that looked like it is trying to be Moroccan- but once you move past that and settle in the food is quite good- I enjoyed the Imperial rolls a shared appetizer as a, they didn't feel to deep fried, .  I had the Pho Ga ( chicken noodle soup) the broth was quite good and as another reviewer has stated it did not have grease floating on top.  The chicken was all white meat and good quality, my only complaint is that I could do with a fewer noodles but that is just a personal preference ( the serving sizes are pretty huge).  Our waitress was attentive and funny, so I would have no trouble suggesting this to others looking for a nice place on Potrero Hill for dinner or lunch.
author: Brian C.

description: i like vietnamese food. this sunflower is way better than the one in the mission. it's cleaner and prettier, and it's easier to park. the food was pretty good (i'd go there again... i got the five spice chicken bun with the imperial rolls), and the service was prompt. my only complaint was that they were reluctant to have us sit on the upholstered bench because they didn't want our two-year-old spilling water on it, but that's kind of a reasonable hesitation (... but at the same time, you shouldn't really have an upholstered bench unless you're going to expect a few spills). anyway, all in all, pretty good.
author: Bella S.

description: Sunflower is a great Potrero Hill restaurant. You might find a 10-20 wait during the lunch hours, but it's worth the wait or just take it "to go". The lunch specials are delicious and a great value for the portion size, I love the imperial rolls. Also, the garlic noodles are awesome! I mainly go during lunch, but I think that the lunch and dinner menus are pretty much the same.
author: Milton F.

description: Dinner here hit the spot the other night. I was recovering from a cold and wanted nothing more than warm soup. I began to crave pho but I didn''t  feel like driving to the TL to get it. I also wanted to try and get non-MSG pho. I wasn't sure such a concept existed or whether it was an oxymoron. The closest thing I found was a vietnamese restaurant in Potrero Hill called Sunflower. The restaurant is characteristically Potrero Hill. It was quaint and filled with local residents. I ordered a bowl of beef noodies while my bf ordered the much talked about garlic noodles. I can't say it was the best pho I have had but it certainly did the trick.  I didn't feel the usual effects of MSG so I assume that there was little to none in the soup. The garlic noodles where quite tasty but nothing particularly special. Only in Potrero Hill does one find cauliflower in their asian noodles and Alaskan beer on the drink menu. That's cool. I will be back here because the food is decent and the atmosphere is warm.
author: Annie Y.

description: Great ambiance, excellent owner, and wonderful food. The garlic noodles were spot-on, as was the curry prawns. Spring rolls are an easy thing to fuck up, but they don't. The service is attentive and the atmosphere is perfect. I'm happy as hell to know that this spot is only a 5 minute walk (oof, uphill) from home.
author: Jess F.

description: We went here on Halloween night which resulted in some great people watching. Since the restaurant was relatively new, we thought we'd check it out. The service was not the greatest. I'm asian myself, but I think the staff had a hard time understanding English and I had a hard time understanding them. The food was mediocre at best. Some dishes were pretty good, some were pretty bland. There's a lot better out there. Try Bodhi in the Mission if you want some good Vietnamese food!
author: Clive L.

description:
Are you serious!?  I just saw it today and thought.. What Sunflower?
When the mission sunflower gets crowded the taste can't be guaranteed. 
This one should be awesome. 
Now we can get real Asian food in Potrero Hill.
The other one is Umi. Linba and Eliza don't count.
author: YEQIN S.

description: A great choice for a delicious and inexpensive Vietnamese meal, suitable for casual or business dining experience.  I eat here often and highly recommend everything, especially the garlic noodles; however, truth be told, I've had their tom yum soup and thought it was undercooked and should have been served hotter.  Otherwise, food is great, service is fast and friendly, and parking in this neighborhood is ample.
author: Jerome E.

description: Garlic noodles = Awesome! Love coming here. Wait staff really quick. Normally don't have a wait.
author: Kimberly B.

description: yum! nice atmosphere, good healthy food options, and great prices! whats not to love?
author: Renee S.

description: As Randy Jackson is known to say..."You know - it was just OK, for me..." But maybe I'm a bit jaded, coming from the Richmond District of SF where good Asian food abounds. The clay pot fish dish was my order and it was waaay too soy saucey and salty for my taste. My friends ordered the bowls and they came with a lot of food but somehow seemed to miss the mark. Oh well. The neighborhood is pretty cool and it was a good opportunity to check it out.
author: LY G.

description:
fair @ best.

unimpressed with all the great reviews. shared the pho which was tasty, but the curry beef was actually .. well, im not sure what it was.. but it was not good. 

pot stickers were fair at best. fun evening, decent food.
author: Art A.

description: Good, but not great.  The food was tasty/okay, and the place was clean.  The service could use some help, but it wasn't horrible.  I guess this place, to us, is just....average.  There certainly isn't anything wrong with it, but we wouldn't go out of our way to go here.  If we lived in the neighborhood, we would probably go again.  But, we don't....so we probably won't.
author: Corey H.

description:
Decor is still middle-eastern from last incarnation. Corner location is great- tables a little close to each other for my comfort.

Vegetarian spring rolls- ok. I would've preferred seafood but my friend was vegetarian. They did offer to leave the sauce at the table.

Garlic eggplant- delicious. I added beef. Huge portions, reasonable prices.
Hate that you have to pay extra for the rice, but brown rice is actually forbidden rice.

They'll serve all the water you can drink. I had about 6 glasses.

Bathroom is clean and nicely decorated, probably from its former incarnation.

**Came back in Dec.- had the beef garlic noodles, my friend had the beef pan fried noodles. Pan fried noodles come with beef and veggies; garlic noodles just with beef and garlic. Better buy:  the non-garlic noodles.

***AVOID the pan fried egg noodles- terrible bland soupy brown sauce with chicken, shrimp, vegetables. No kick- boring.

****Shaken beef- good and tender, spiced but not hot. I wish the rice was $1.50 rather than $2- $2 just seems like a ripoff for small bowl.
author: KD D.

description: We always have enjoyed the Sunflower in the Mission, though weren't thrilled about heading over there, trying to find a quick parking spot to pick up our take-out.  So we were super excited when we heard Sunflower was opening an outpost over there on the hill.  Their 'pho' (they list it as noodle soup) is super yummy and the garlic noodles are great too, if sometimes a tad overpowering.  And their prices can't be beat.  As for the people railing on their decor, I love that they kept the decor from the now defunct Baraka.  It's a nice cheap date night for takeout or eat-in.  And I am glad to see that it is getting crowded.  Sunflower, we want to keep you here in the neighborhood!
author: Naka H.

description: Convenient, Solid and affordable have all been well noted on this long list of reviews. I agree. I live on Treasure Island and Potrero is an easy place for me to get to with relative easy parking. Sunflower has good Beef Pho and Bun/Vermicelli. Friends really dig the insanely garlicky Garlic Noodles but that ain't my cup O tea. I love garlic but in moderation. Anyway. I've also sampled the House Fried Rice which is some lightly fried rice with chicken and prawns. They have a nice little bottled beer selection. Victory Prima Pils was a pleasant surprise. Believe they've had Allagash as well. Anchor, Sapporo and Sierra Nevada are always available. I see lots of folks drinking wine and enjoying that but cannot attest to the list. The atmosphere is nice i.e. good enough for a date and the service is decent. Some of the waitresses remember me and like joking around. The prices are reasonable and the quality consistent in the dozen times I've been there in the past 4 months.
author: Nathaniel G.

description: Always fresh and service with a friendly smile. I've been here a number of times and love the imperial rolls.
author: Ear To The Ground X.

description: Great authentic pho and garlic noodles.  Service a little off sometimes, but if you're not in a hurry it doesn't really matter.
author: Justin F.

description: I rarely give 5 stars, but this restaurant deserved it. It was a saturday night, around 7pm. We were seated within 15 minutes, as the small place was pleasantly packed. We ordered Imperial Rolls (best I have had in the city -- also great were the ones at Aux Delices on Polk), Shaking Beef (super tender, great flavor); Garlic Noodles (by far the very best in the City) and Lemongrass Chicken (great flavor, tons of crispy green beans). The portions were generous, the prices were reasonable, and the service was attentive. I will be visiting again very soon!
author: rachel s.

description:
I've had the chance to go to Sunflower at lunch and dinner and both experiences have been great. They offer substantial portions and the lunch specials really fill you up. 

The restaurant is cozy and warm, and the service was excellent. The host really made sure that we were satisfied with our meal and was very hospitable. 

Finally: garlic noodles and imperial rolls. What more can I say? They're really good.
author: Stephen C.

description: I love Sunflower as a casual, easy dining spot. I've never had a long wait and the food is always great. Service is friendly and fast. Portions are large and the prices are surprisingly low for what you get.
author: Josh L.

description: The food was so fantastic.  Great portions but only one sever and one helper the day after T-Day?????  That's a big go out for anything totally different from turkey day... i.e., Asian food!.... I want and will probably give it five stars next time, but the poor server was so stressed and seemed annoyed w/ our twin 4 year olds..... and the people around us seemed annoyed w/ kids too.  Maybe everyone was just hung over and cranky.  We'll keep going back.  yum!
author: Kristen S.

description: I work in the neighborhood and took out beef noodle soup for lunch the other day. It was relatively cheap, considering the gigantic portions, and very tasty. I love that they gave me the raw beef and veggies on the side so it didn't get overcooked on my walk back. Plenty for 2 lunches which is a huge bonus!
author: Crissy G.

description: I have been a customer at the Valencia branch for over a decade now.  I love the food and the waiter's attitude there.  But I was so pleased to find the Potrero Hill branch.
